title: NSDL Board to Consider Q1 FY26 Results on August 12, 2025
content: National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL) will hold a board meeting on August 12, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 (Q1 FY26). The board will also review the Limited Review Report during the meeting. NSDL previously uploaded the notice of the board meeting intimation to its website on August 01, 2025.

title: BHEL shares fall over 6 percent as CLSA recommends 'Underperform' after net loss doubles
content: Shares of power plant equipment manufacturer BHEL were sharply lower by over 6 percent in early trade on August 7, reacting to the sharp widening of loss in the June quarter, with CLSA issuing an 'Underperform' call with a target price of Rs 198 per share, lower by over 17 percent compared to previous close. State-owned Bharat Heavy Electricals (BHEL) said its net loss more than doubled to Rs 455.50 crore in the June quarter mainly due to higher expenses, compared to a net loss of Rs 211.40 crore a year ago. The total income rose slightly to Rs 5,658.07 crore in the quarter compared to Rs 5,581.78 crore a year ago. CLSA in its note said the June quarter results missed consensus estimates as execution of order rose by a mere 4 percent on year. The street was anticipating am operational turnaround after two years of weak growth, but the performance was disappointing. The government's focus on energy security led to a resurgence in fossil fuel orders in the June quarter, with BHEL's thermal business orders peaking at 26.6 GW during FY25, CLSA noted. BHEL's outstanding orderbook as on June 2025 stood at 2.04 lakh crore, with 21 percent share from exports. In the last one month, BHEL's shares are down 13 percent and on YTD basis, they are lower by 4 percent.
summary_lexrank: Shares of power plant equipment manufacturer BHEL were sharply lower by over 6 percent in early trade on August 7, reacting to the sharp widening of loss in the June quarter, with CLSA issuing an 'Underperform' call with a target price of Rs 198 per share, lower by over 17 percent compared to previous close.
summary_luhn: Shares of power plant equipment manufacturer BHEL were sharply lower by over 6 percent in early trade on August 7, reacting to the sharp widening of loss in the June quarter, with CLSA issuing an 'Underperform' call with a target price of Rs 198 per share, lower by over 17 percent compared to previous close.
summary_lsa: CLSA in its note said the June quarter results missed consensus estimates as execution of order rose by a mere 4 percent on year.

title: NSDL rises 7%, extends post-listing gains to 13%; newly-listed Sri Lotus rises 4%, Laxmi India Finance falls 4%
content: The shares of National Securities Depository (NSDL) gained nearly 7 percent on August 7, extending significant gains for the second consecutive session since market debut. The shares of the company are now around 25 percent higher than the IPO price. Sri Lotus Developers shares also extended significant gains, jumping over 4 percent on its second session. Laxmi India Finance shares however dropped over 3 percent. NSDL share price: The shares of NSDL had made a decent stock market debut on August 6, listing at Rs 880 apiece on BSE. This marked a premium of 10 percent over its IPO price at Rs 880 apiece. The listing premium was lower than grey market estimates. Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium of nearly 16 percent over the IPO price. According to analysts, investors should consider holding the stock for the long term, given NSDL’s strong fundamentals and leadership in the depository segment. The shares have now gained over 13 percent in the two sessions since their market debut. The stock later pared some gains to trade 5 percent higher at Rs 978.85 apiece, as seen at 10.30 am. Sri Lotus Developers: Sri Lotus Developers shares jumped more than 4 percent to trade at Rs 204.35 apiece. This comes a day after the stock rallied 10 percent to close in the upper circuit at Rs 195.80 per share on its debut day. The stock is currently over 36 percent higher than its IPO price of Rs 150 per share, and has gained over 14 percent since listing. The shares of the Mumbai-based luxury real estate developer debuted at Rs 179 apiece, marking a premium of 19 percent over the IPO price. This came after the Rs 792-crore IPO garnered a strong 69 times subscription during its three days of public bidding. The listing premium was more or less at par with grey market estimates. Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium (GMP) of nearly 18 percent over the IPO price. Laxmi India Finance: Laxmi India Finance shares dropped 4 percent on August 7 to trade at Rs 119 apiece. The stock has now extended gains for the third consecutive session, after listing at a discount of nearly 13 percent over the IPO price on August 5. The stock is currently down nearly 25 percent from its IPO price of Rs 158, and has dropped more than 13 percent from its opening price of Rs 137 apiece. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The stock is currently over 36 percent higher than its IPO price of Rs 150 per share, and has gained over 14 percent since listing.
summary_luhn: Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium of nearly 16 percent over the IPO price.
summary_lsa: This came after the Rs 792-crore IPO garnered a strong 69 times subscription during its three days of public bidding.
summary_textrank: Ahead of listing, the unlisted shares of the company were trading with a grey market premium of nearly 16 percent over the IPO price.

title: Radico Khaitan Q1 FY26: IMFL Volume Up 38% YoY, Net Debt Reduced
content: Radico Khaitan (RADICO) reported a 38% surge in total IMFL volume, reaching 9.72 million cases in Q1 FY26.Q1 FY26 Financial ResultsMetricQ1 FY26Q1 FY25YoY ChangeIMFL Volume9.72 million cases38%Financial PerformanceRadico Khaitan announced its highest-ever quarterly volumes in Q1 FY26. Volume in the Prestige and above category increased by 41%, while non-IMFL revenue grew by 12% year-on-year. Gross margin stood at 43%, up from 41% in Q1 of the previous year. EBITDA margin expanded to 15.3%, compared to 13.0% in Q1 FY25. The company's net debt has been reduced by ₹164 crores since March 2025, driven by profitability and working capital reduction. Radico Khaitan expects to be nearly debt-free by FY27, citing limited Capex going forward.Operational HighlightsRadico Khaitan marked the beginning of FY26 with key brand milestones, which included the launch of Morpheus Super Premium Whisky and The Spirit of Kashmyr, a luxury vodka. Royal Ranthambore, operating in the Bottled in India Scotch category, posted a 90% growth this quarter. Magic Moments, the company's flagship vodka brand, continued its strong performance with 20% volume growth. After Dark Whisky, enhanced with After Dark Blue in 2022, sold 1.9 million cases last year and is on track to double that volume in the current fiscal year. The company's luxury and semi-luxury brands delivered nearly 50% year-on-year value growth during the quarter and are projected to achieve revenue of ₹500 crores in FY26.Management CommentaryAbhishek Khaitan, Managing Director, stated that the first quarter of FY26 has set a positive tone for the year. Following finalized negotiations and the signing of a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, duty on bulk scotch has been reduced from 150% to 75%. The company anticipates cost advantages from its Scotch requirements, valued at over ₹250 crores in FY26. Dilip Banthiya, CFO, reported a total IMFL volume of 9.72 million cases, reflecting a 38% year-on-year growth and marking the highest volume ever recorded by Radico Khaitan in a single quarter. The company expects to deliver over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, with significant contributions from the prestige and above category. This growth, along with improved profitability and a focus on cash flow generation, aims to drive long-term shareholder value. Radico Khaitan anticipates delivering over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, supported by the prestige and above category.
summary_lexrank: Radico Khaitan anticipates delivering over 20% overall volume growth in FY26, supported by the prestige and above category.
summary_luhn: Dilip Banthiya, CFO, reported a total IMFL volume of 9.72 million cases, reflecting a 38% year-on-year growth and marking the highest volume ever recorded by Radico Khaitan in a single quarter.
summary_lsa: This growth, along with improved profitability and a focus on cash flow generation, aims to drive long-term shareholder value.
summary_textrank: The company's luxury and semi-luxury brands delivered nearly 50% year-on-year value growth during the quarter and are projected to achieve revenue of ₹500 crores in FY26.Management CommentaryAbhishek Khaitan, Managing Director, stated that the first quarter of FY26 has set a positive tone for the year.

title: ITC shares gain 0.5% in today's session; about 20 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 414 on the NSE, a gain of 0.5% from the previous close, with nearly 20 lakh shares traded at 10:38 am on Thursday. On the financial front, ITC has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 4.19, slightly higher than the Rs 4.08 recorded in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit stood at Rs 19,926.05 Crore for year-ending March 2025, slightly down from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than the Rs 16.42 recorded in March 2024. Key financial figures are summarized below:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00ITC has a history of rewarding its shareholders with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share was announced on February 6, 2025, effective from February 12, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue occurring on July 1, 2016, in the ratio of 1:2. Additionally, ITC underwent a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the face value was reduced from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Key financial ratios for ITC show a P/E ratio of 14.74 and a P/B ratio of 7.32. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. ITC is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 414 on the NSE, a gain of 0.5% from the previous close, with nearly 20 lakh shares traded.

title: Adani Green Energy shares fall 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Adani Green Energy Limited declined by 2.07% to Rs 937.75 in Thursday's session. At 10:18 am, the stock is trading lower compared to its previous close. The company’s consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,800 Crore, which is an increase compared to previous quarters. The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 3,073 Crore, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 2,365 Crore, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 3,055 Crore and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 2,834 Crore. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 707 Crore. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 292 Crore, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 400 Crore, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 416 Crore and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 449 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 4.26, when compared to previous quarters. The EPS for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 1.26, for the quarter ending December 2024 was Rs 2.92, for the quarter ending September 2024 was Rs 1.56 and for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 2.63. The company’s consolidated annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,212 Crore. The revenue for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 9,220 Crore, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 7,792 Crore, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 5,133 Crore and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 3,124 Crore. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,557 Crore. The net profit for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 971 Crore, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 914 Crore, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 488 Crore and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 176 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 8.37, as compared to previous years. The EPS for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 6.21, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 5.41, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 2.41 and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 0.68. The book value per share (BVPS) for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 67.63. The BVPS for the year ending March 2024 was Rs 53.09, for the year ending March 2023 was Rs 37.41, for the year ending March 2022 was Rs 7.61 and for the year ending March 2021 was Rs 5.03. Key financial ratios for Adani Green Energy Limited are as follows: P/E (x) is 113.34, P/B (x) is 14.03, and EV/EBITDA (x) is 23.35. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 7.29 as of the year ending March 2025. Adani Green Energy Limited has scheduled an Extra Ordinary General Meeting on August 26, 2025. Shares of Adani Green Energy Limited are included in the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. A Moneycontrol analysis, as of July 31, 2025, indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 937.75, Adani Green Energy Limited has seen a decrease from its previous close.

title: Eternal shares decline 2.49% amid volume surge; stock among top losers on Nifty 50

title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 0.95%, stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,911.40, a 0.95% decline. The stock is currently among the top losers on Nifty 50 at 10:10 am. Bharti Airtel is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated financial performance of Bharti Airtel:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-Rs 27.65Rs 7.67Rs 14.80Rs 13.09Rs 58.00The company's revenue has consistently increased over the years. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 172,985.20 Crore, up from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. Net profit has also seen a significant increase, reaching Rs 33,778.30 Crore for the year ending March 2025 as compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 13.09 in March 2024 to Rs 58.00 in March 2025. The following table presents the quarterly consolidated financial data:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPSRs 7.21Rs 6.21Rs 25.54Rs 19.02Rs 10.26The company's quarterly revenue increased steadily from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also showed variations across the quarters, with a notable increase in December 2024, reaching Rs 14,474.90 Crore. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel include a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Prior to this, dividends of Rs 8.00 per share and Rs 4.00 per share were announced on May 14, 2024, and May 16, 2023, respectively. Bharti Airtel had a split with exsplit date on July 24, 2009 where old face value was 10 and new face value was 5. Recent announcements include the audio/video recording of the earnings call on August 06, 2025, publication of newspaper advertisements for the audited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, and intimation of approval of grant of stock options by the HR & Nomination Committee. A recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,911.40, Bharti Airtel is currently among the top losers on Nifty 50.

title: Adani Ports shares fall 1.73%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Adani Ports were trading lower at 10:00 am on Thursday. The current price of the stock is Rs 1,343.40, which is a 1.73% decrease from its previous close. This decline positions Adani Ports among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. The consolidated revenue for Adani Ports shows a fluctuating trend over the past five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 7,559.59 Crore, which decreased to Rs 7,067.02 Crore in September 2024. It then increased to Rs 7,963.55 Crore in December 2024, further rising to Rs 8,488.44 Crore by March 2025 and reaching Rs 9,126.14 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. The net profit followed a similar pattern, with Rs 3,184.39 Crore in June 2024, falling to Rs 2,414.01 Crore in September 2024, and then recovering to Rs 2,467.04 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 2,854.26 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,153.30 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also mirrored this trend, starting at Rs 14.41 in June 2024, dipping to Rs 11.32 in September 2024, and subsequently rising to Rs 11.67 in December 2024, Rs 13.95 in March 2025, and Rs 15.34 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 7,559.59 CroreRs 7,067.02 CroreRs 7,963.55 CroreRs 8,488.44 CroreRs 9,126.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,184.39 CroreRs 2,414.01 CroreRs 2,467.04 CroreRs 2,854.26 CroreRs 3,153.30 CroreEPS14.4111.3211.6713.9515.34The company’s annual consolidated financial performance reveals consistent growth from 2021 to 2025. Revenue increased steadily from Rs 12,549.60 Crore in 2021 to Rs 31,078.60 Crore in 2025. Net profit also showed a substantial rise, from Rs 5,063.01 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,919.70 Crore in 2025. Similarly, earnings per share (EPS) grew from Rs 24.58 in 2021 to Rs 51.35 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 157.04 in 2021 to Rs 288.26 in 2025, and the Return on Equity (ROE) rose from 16.40% in 2021 to 17.81% in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio decreased from 1.13 in 2021 to 0.73 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,549.60 CroreRs 15,934.03 CroreRs 20,851.91 CroreRs 26,710.56 CroreRs 31,078.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,063.01 CroreRs 4,602.39 CroreRs 5,344.97 CroreRs 8,265.68 CroreRs 10,919.70 CroreEPS24.5822.3924.5837.5551.35BVPS157.04182.15216.45251.73288.26ROE16.40%12.41%11.69%15.36%17.81%Debt to Equity1.131.191.090.870.73Adani Ports announced a final dividend of Rs 7.00 per share (350%) with an effective date of June 13, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on May 17, 2010, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2, effective from September 23, 2010. The company also made several announcements, including investor group intimations and the release of audio recordings from analyst/investor calls pertaining to the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. With the stock currently trading lower, Adani Ports is trading at Rs 1,343.40 at 10:00 am on the Nifty 50.

title: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares decline 4.02% amid high volume, among top midcap losers

title: ITC shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; up 0.44%
content: Shares of ITC were trading higher in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 413.80, a 0.44% increase as of 10:10 am. The stock is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot ITC's consolidated financial performance reveals the following: The company's quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,765.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in the previous quarter. The annual revenue for the year 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 70,881.00 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 20,723.75 Crore reported in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) for the year 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than the Rs 16.42 reported in 2024. Key financial ratios for ITC show a P/E ratio of 14.74 and a P/B ratio of 7.32 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. ITC had previously announced a bonus issue on May 20, 2016, with an existing ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of July 1, 2016. The company had split its shares on June 17, 2005, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 1, with an ex-split date of September 21, 2005. title: Trent shares rise 2% after Q1 results, but brokerages flag slow revenue growth; should you buy, sell or hold?
content: The shares of Trent gained nearly 2 percent in early morning trade on August 7 after the company's Q1 earnings boosted investor sentiment. The shares of the Tata Group company were trading at Rs 5,440 apiece. Trent Ltd, which operates the apparel stores Zudio and Westside, reported a net profit of Rs 423 crore for the April-June quarter of the financial year 2026. This marks a 24 percent on-year rise from the Rs 342 crore net profit reported in the year-ago period. The Tata Group company's revenue from operations meanwhile rose 20 percent on-year to Rs 4,781 crore in Q1 FY26, as against Rs 3,992 crore in Q1 FY25. The consolidated profit rose 9 percent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 429.7 crore, excluding the exceptional items impact. The Operating EBIT margin for Q1 FY26 stood at 11.4 percent, as against 10.6 percent in Q1 FY25. Should you buy, sell or hold? Motilal Oswal retained its 'Buy' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 6,400 apiece. This implies an upside potential of around 19.5 percent from the stock's previous closing price of Rs 5,356 apiece. The domestic brokerage noted that the company delivered a strong EBITDA growth of approximately 37 percent on-year, beating its estimate by around 17 percent, despite a continued deceleration in revenue growth and sharp decline in gross margin. "The significant margin beat was led by effective cost control—employee expenses fell 7% YoY, while rental costs rose only 7% YoY, despite a 36% increase in retail area, reflecting the strength of Trent’s variable cost structure," Motilal Oswal said, while noting that its Star business underperformed with just 7 percent on-year revenue growth, flat like-for-like sales, and a 14 percent on-year drop in revenue per square feet. "We continue to like Trent for its robust footprint additions, strong double digit growth, long runway for growth in Star (presence in just 10 cities), and potential scale-up of emerging categories (Beauty, Innerwear, Footwear, and LGDs). However, revenue growth acceleration remains a key trigger," it added. Bernstein has an 'Outperform' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 6,500 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 21 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage however, also highlighted the slowing growth in revenue and significant reduction in revenue per square feet, CNBC-TV18 reported. Citi kept an 'Buy' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 7,150 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 33 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage noted that while the revenue growth slowed down, it is still ahead of the other discretionary players, according to the note cited by the business channel. Nuvama Institutional Equities maintained its 'Hold' rating on the stock, but reduced its target price to Rs 5,850 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 9 percent from the stock’s previous closing price. The brokerage said that the Tata Group company delivered strong margin improvement despite lower productivity. Trent share price history: The shares of the company later pared some gains to trade nearly 1 percent higher at Rs 5,396.50 apiece. The stock has gained nearly 8 percent in the past five days, but dropped nearly 2 percent in the past one month. It currently has a P/E ratio of around 125. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The domestic brokerage noted that the company delivered a strong EBITDA growth of approximately 37 percent on-year, beating its estimate by around 17 percent, despite a continued deceleration in revenue growth and sharp decline in gross margin.
summary_luhn: "The significant margin beat was led by effective cost control—employee expenses fell 7% YoY, while rental costs rose only 7% YoY, despite a 36% increase in retail area, reflecting the strength of Trent’s variable cost structure," Motilal Oswal said, while noting that its Star business underperformed with just 7 percent on-year revenue growth, flat like-for-like sales, and a 14 percent on-year drop in revenue per square feet.
summary_lsa: "The significant margin beat was led by effective cost control—employee expenses fell 7% YoY, while rental costs rose only 7% YoY, despite a 36% increase in retail area, reflecting the strength of Trent’s variable cost structure," Motilal Oswal said, while noting that its Star business underperformed with just 7 percent on-year revenue growth, flat like-for-like sales, and a 14 percent on-year drop in revenue per square feet.

title: Berger Paints India share price falls 2.07% in early trade
content: In early trade, shares of Berger Paints India experienced a decline of 2.07%, reaching Rs 553.60 on the NSE, as of 9:59 am. This marks a notable price movement from its previous close.Financial PerformanceBerger Paints India has demonstrated growth in both quarterly and annual revenues. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,200.76 Crore, compared to Rs 3,091.01 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024, representing an increase of approximately 3.55%. The net profit for the same period was Rs 303.87 Crore in June 2025, against Rs 344.41 Crore in June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 2.70 in June 2025, compared to Rs 3.03 in June 2024. Annually, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 11,544.71 Crore, up from Rs 11,198.92 Crore in the year-ending March 2024, an increase of around 3.1%. The net profit also saw an increase, with Rs 1,147.75 Crore recorded for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,128.80 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS increased to Rs 10.13 in March 2025 from Rs 10.02 in March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)Mar 20216,817.59725.337.41Mar 20228,761.78829.098.58Mar 202310,567.84873.578.86Mar 202411,198.921,128.8010.02Mar 202511,544.711,147.7510.13Balance Sheet HighlightsThe company’s balance sheet reflects a stable financial position. As of March 2025, the share capital stood at Rs 116 Crore, with reserves and surplus of Rs 6,037 Crore. Total assets were valued at Rs 9,131 Crore, compared to Rs 8,368 Crore in the previous year.Key Financial RatiosKey financial ratios for Berger Paints India show a P/E ratio of 49.38 and a P/B ratio of 9.47 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.02 as of the year-ending March 2025.Cash Flow StatementThe cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,269 Crore, compared to Rs 1,591 Crore in the previous year. The net cash flow stood at Rs 13 Crore for the same period.Corporate ActionsBerger Paints India has a history of corporate actions, including dividends and bonus issues. The most recent dividend was announced on May 14, 2025, with a final dividend of Rs 3.80 per share. The effective date for this dividend is August 5, 2025.Corporate AnnouncementsRecent corporate announcements include investor presentations on financial results for the quarter-ending June 30, 2025. These presentations provide insights into the company's performance and strategies. Recent Moneycontrol analysis indicated bearish sentiment on Berger Paints India as of July 31, 2025. With the last traded price at Rs 553.60, Berger Paints India has experienced a decrease in early trade.

title: Coforge share price rises 2.04% in morning trade
content: Shares of COFORGE LIMITED gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 1,671.70 in Thursday's session. At 9:56 am, the stock showed positive movement in today's trade. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,688.60 Crore, up from Rs 3,409.90 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 356.40 Crore, compared to Rs 307.30 Crore in the previous quarter. Coforge announced a stock split with an ex-split date and record date of June 4, 2025. The old face value was Rs 10, and the new face value is Rs 2. title: Bharti Hexacom share price falls 2.23% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharti Hexacom declined 2.23% to Rs 1,755.10 in Thursday's early trading session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In standalone quarterly results, for the quarter ending June 2025, Bharti Hexacom reported sales of Rs 2,263 Crore. Other income was Rs 47 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 2,310 Crore. The total expenditure amounted to Rs 1,629 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 680 Crore. Interest payments were Rs 154 Crore, and taxes accounted for Rs 135 Crore. The net profit for the quarter stood at Rs 391 Crore. In comparison, for the quarter ending March 2025, sales were Rs 2,289 Crore and net profit was Rs 468 Crore. The company's standalone annual financials reveal that for the year ending March 2025, sales reached Rs 8,547 Crore. Other income was Rs 181 Crore, culminating in a total income of Rs 8,729 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 6,232 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 2,497 Crore. Interest payments summed up to Rs 688 Crore, and taxes were Rs 315 Crore. The net profit reported was Rs 1,493 Crore. In comparison, for the year ending March 2024, sales were Rs 7,088 Crore and net profit was Rs 504 Crore, representing an increase in sales and net profit. The net cash flow was Rs -22 Crore. The balance sheet for the year ending March 2025 shows that the share capital was Rs 250 Crore and reserves & surplus were Rs 5,682 Crore. The fixed assets were valued at Rs 15,030 Crore, current assets at Rs 1,918 Crore and other assets at Rs 2,302 Crore. The total assets were Rs 19,251 Crore. Contingent liabilities were Rs 760 Crore. Key financial ratios indicate that the basic EPS and diluted EPS for March 2025 were both Rs 29.87, and the book value per share was Rs 118.64. The dividend per share was Rs 10.00, with a face value of Rs 5. Margin ratios show a gross profit margin of 51.22%, operating margin of 26.72%, and net profit margin of 17.47%. Return ratios include a return on net worth/equity of 25.17%, ROCE of 18.40%, and return on assets of 7.75%. Liquidity ratios show a current ratio and quick ratio of 0.28. Leverage ratios indicate a debt to equity ratio of 0.64 and interest coverage ratio of 6.36. The asset turnover ratio was 0.45, and the 3-year CAGR for sales was 25.75%, while net profit was -5.56%. Valuation ratios show a P/E ratio of 49.01 and P/B ratio of 12.28. Bharti Hexacom announced a final dividend of Rs 10 per share on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. The company also announced a final dividend of Rs 4 per share on May 14, 2024, with an effective date of August 16, 2024. Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis as of July 31, 2025, suggests a very bullish outlook for Bharti Hexacom.

title: KPR Mill share price falls 5.29% among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KPR Mill declined 5.29% to Rs 983.80 in Thursday's early trading session. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 9.17 am. title: Lupin shares rise 2.03% in early trade
content: Shares of Lupin gained 2.03% in Thursday's session, with the stock currently trading at Rs 1,889.40. This increase comes as the broader market is showing some positive momentum. At 09:17 am, Lupin showed a notable price movement from its previous close, reflecting investor activity. Moneycontrol analysis, as of July 31, 2025, suggests a very bearish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,889.40, Lupin exhibits a positive trend in today's early trading session.

title: Tata Investment Corporation shares fall 2.07% in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Investment Corporation declined by 2.07% to Rs 6,937.50 in early trade. This decline reflects a shift in investor sentiment for the stock. At 09:23 am, Tata Investment Corporation was trading lower on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150. The company's recent financial performance shows a mix of quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 145.46 Crore, up from Rs 142.46 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 112.40 Crore, compared to Rs 106.78 Crore in the previous year. Here's a summary of Tata Investment Corporation's key quarterly financial data:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 142.46 CroreRs 142.48 CroreRs 3.71 CroreRs 16.43 CroreRs 145.46 CroreNet ProfitRs 106.78 CroreRs 100.50 CroreRs -6.64 CroreRs 8.50 CroreRs 112.40 CroreEPS25.9124.453.887.4628.92The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 305.08 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 383.12 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 209.14 Crore, down from Rs 320.32 Crore in the previous year. The company's key annual financial data is presented below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 163.14 CroreRs 253.85 CroreRs 277.16 CroreRs 383.12 CroreRs 305.08 CroreNet ProfitRs 129.91 CroreRs 196.61 CroreRs 216.09 CroreRs 320.32 CroreRs 209.14 CroreEPS30.4442.3449.7876.0961.68BVPS2,814.663,889.253,868.675,922.516,144.99ROE1.081.081.281.281.00Debt to Equity0.000.000.010.000.00Tata Investment Corporation has announced a split, with the announcement date being August 4, 2025. The old face value was Rs 10, and the new face value is Rs 1. The ex-split date and record date are not available. The company also has a history of dividend payouts. The most recent dividend, announced on April 21, 2025, was a final dividend of Rs 27.00 per share. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 7, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 6,937.50, Tata Investment Corporation is experiencing a decline in today's session.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,529.40 on the NSE, down by 0.24% in early trade. This slight decrease reflects a change of Rs 6.20 from the previous close, observed at 9:30 am during Thursday's session. Hindustan Unilever is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. title: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares fall 4.20%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Bharat Heavy Electricals experienced a decline of 4.20% in early trade, with the stock price at Rs 229.76. This movement was observed during Thursday's session. The stock is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Bharat Heavy Electricals announced its financial results for the quarter ended June 2025. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 5,486.91 Crore, a marginal increase compared to Rs 5,484.92 Crore in June 2024. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs -469.17 Crore for the same period, compared to a loss of Rs -225.61 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs -1.31, compared to Rs -0.61 in June 2024. The company’s consolidated annual revenue saw a significant increase to Rs 28,339.48 Crore for the year ended March 2025, compared to Rs 23,892.78 Crore for the year ended March 2024. The net profit for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 474.89 Crore, up from Rs 218.24 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 1.53, compared to Rs 0.81 in the year ended March 2024. Bharat Heavy Electricals Consolidated Financials:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 17,308.69 CroreRs 21,211.09 CroreRs 23,364.94 CroreRs 23,892.78 CroreRs 28,339.48 CroreNet Profit-Rs 2,743.84 CroreRs 394.29 CroreRs 421.37 CroreRs 218.24 CroreRs 474.89 CroreEPS-7.751.281.370.811.53BVPS74.5976.1277.0570.1871.00ROE-10.381.681.771.152.15Debt to Equity0.190.180.200.360.36The revenue for the year ended March 2025 increased by 18.61% compared to the previous year. The net profit also saw a significant rise, increasing by 117.59% during the same period. Bharat Heavy Electricals has announced a final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (25%) with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Shares of Bharat Heavy Electricals experienced a decline of 4.20% in early trade.

title: Hitachi Energy India shares rise 2.40% in early trade
content: Shares of Hitachi Energy India gained 2.40% to trade at Rs 20,910.00 in Thursday's early session. The stock is currently trading on a very bullish sentiment. Hitachi Energy India is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. The company's standalone annual financial performance shows consistent growth. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 6,384 Crore, compared to Rs 5,237 Crore in March 2024. Other income increased from Rs 9 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 57 Crore in March 2025. Total income for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,442 Crore, up from Rs 5,246 Crore in the previous year. Total expenditure also increased from Rs 4,978 Crore to Rs 5,880 Crore during the same period. The company's EBIT (Earnings Before Interest and Tax) increased to Rs 561 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 268 Crore in March 2024. Interest paid remained relatively stable at Rs 45 Crore in March 2025. The company's tax expenses increased to Rs 132 Crore, and net profit increased significantly to Rs 383 Crore for the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Standalone Annual)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Dec 2020SalesRs 6,384 CroreRs 5,237 CroreRs 4,468 CroreRs 4,883 CroreRs 3,420 CroreOther IncomeRs 57 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 15 CroreRs 66 CroreRs 18 CroreTotal IncomeRs 6,442 CroreRs 5,246 CroreRs 4,483 CroreRs 4,950 CroreRs 3,438 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 5,880 CroreRs 4,978 CroreRs 4,312 CroreRs 4,632 CroreRs 3,282 CroreEBITRs 561 CroreRs 268 CroreRs 170 CroreRs 317 CroreRs 156 CroreInterestRs 45 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 40 CroreRs 41 CroreRs 20 CroreTaxRs 132 CroreRs 57 CroreRs 36 CroreRs 73 CroreRs 36 CroreNet ProfitRs 383 CroreRs 163 CroreRs 93 CroreRs 203 CroreRs 99 CroreThe company has also shown strong quarterly results. For the quarter-ending June 2025, sales stood at Rs 1,478 Crore, while net profit was Rs 131 Crore. In comparison, the quarter-ending March 2025 recorded sales of Rs 1,883 Crore and a net profit of Rs 183 Crore.Financials (Standalone Quarterly)Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 1,478 CroreRs 1,883 CroreRs 1,620 CroreRs 1,553 CroreRs 1,327 CroreOther IncomeRs 50 CroreRs 38 CroreRs 52 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreTotal IncomeRs 1,529 CroreRs 1,921 CroreRs 1,672 CroreRs 1,553 CroreRs 1,327 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,349 CroreRs 1,669 CroreRs 1,476 CroreRs 1,466 CroreRs 1,301 CroreEBITRs 180 CroreRs 252 CroreRs 196 CroreRs 87 CroreRs 25 CroreInterestRs 3 CroreRs 5 CroreRs 11 CroreRs 16 CroreRs 10 CroreTaxRs 45 CroreRs 62 CroreRs 46 CroreRs 18 CroreRs 4 CroreNet ProfitRs 131 CroreRs 183 CroreRs 137 CroreRs 52 CroreRs 10 CroreKey financial ratios indicate a positive outlook. Basic EPS and Diluted EPS both stand at Rs 90.36 for March 2025. The book value per share is Rs 944.87, and the company declared a dividend of Rs 6.00 per share. The face value is Rs 2. The company’s board announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, with an effective date of August 13, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 4.00 per share on August 14, 2024, and Rs 3.40 per share on August 10, 2023. The company’s board also made an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding Earnings Call Transcript on August 6, 2025.

title: Hero Motocorp share price gains 1.79%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher in Thursday's session. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, trading at Rs 4,555.00, a 1.79% increase from its previous close, at 9:30 am. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included Trent, Cipla, Titan Company and Tech Mahindra.Financial PerformanceHere's a look at Hero Motocorp's financial performance, comparing quarterly and yearly results.RevenueThe company's consolidated quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, down from Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 40,923.42 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 37,788.62 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,923 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 37,788 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Other income also increased to Rs 1,044 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 854 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 35,802 Crore, up from Rs 33,356 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) increased to Rs 6,165 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 5,286 Crore in March 2024. Here is a table summarizing the key figures:ParticularsMar 2025 (Rs Crore)Mar 2024 (Rs Crore)Mar 2023 (Rs Crore)Mar 2022 (Rs Crore)Mar 2021 (Rs Crore)Sales40,92337,78834,15829,55130,959Other Income1,044854569555557Total Income41,96738,64334,72730,10631,517Total Expenditure35,80233,35630,76226,79627,574EBIT6,1655,2863,9653,3103,942Interest70761045346Tax1,5571,3481,063729913Net Profit4,5363,8622,7962,5282,982Net ProfitThe consolidated quarterly net profit for June 2025 was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, a decrease from Rs 1,086.35 Crore in June 2024. The consolidated yearly net profit has increased, with Rs 4,536.93 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 3,862.41 Crore for the year-ending March 2024.EPSThe consolidated quarterly EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, up from Rs 52.31 in June 2024. The yearly EPS has also increased, with Rs 218.96 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 187.36 for the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios show a basic EPS of Rs 218.96 and a diluted EPS of Rs 218.96 for the year-ending March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 963.60. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.02 as of the year-ending March 2025.ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Basic EPS (Rs.)218.96187.36140.62115.96146.07Diluted EPS (Rs.)218.96187.04140.62115.93146.04Book Value/Share (Rs.)963.60892.17839.66800.54778.76Dividend/Share (Rs.)165.00140.00100.0095.00105.00Face Value22222Corporate ActionsHero Motocorp has announced several corporate actions. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 24, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. The company has also had bonus issues in the past, with the most recent one on August 4, 1998, in the ratio of 1:1. A stock split occurred on January 30, 2001, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2, with an ex-split date of March 12, 2001. Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading higher in Thursday's session and were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: Tata Motors shares fall 1.3%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were trading lower in Thursday's session. The stock declined 1.3% to Rs 644.35, making it among the top losers on the Nifty 50. Kotak Mahindra, Jio Financial, Tata Steel and ONGC were also among the top Nifty losers in Today's session. title: Hero MotoCorp shares rise 2% after Q1; firm expects retain demand to remain strong
content: Shares of Hero MotoCorp rose as much as 2 percent to Rs 4,580 in morning trade on August 7 after the company reported a mixed June quarter. The stock is likely to react further as investors await cues from the management’s commentary during the scheduled investor call at 10:30 am. The two-wheeler major posted a flat net profit of Rs 1,126 crore for Q1FY26, marginally higher than Rs 1,123 crore in the same quarter last year, and ahead of estimates. A Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerages had pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates However, revenue declined 5.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 9,579 crore from Rs 10,144 crore in Q1FY25, reflecting pressure on top-line performance despite stable margins. Chief Financial Officer Vivek Anand said profitability remained resilient, supported by healthy demand for entry-level and deluxe motorcycles and the 125cc scooter segment. He added that the company’s electric mobility business under the VIDA brand continued to gain momentum, while international operations outperformed the broader market. The company said it expects retail demand to remain strong in the coming quarters, aided by festive tailwinds and a robust pipeline of new product launches. At about 9:45 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,561, higher by 1.9 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hero MotoCorp shares have risen 18 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Lupin shares jump 4.2%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Thursday's session, Lupin's stock demonstrated strong performance, securing its position among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 09:30 am, Lupin was trading at Rs 1,930.10, reflecting a gain of 4.23%. Financial Performance: Lupin's financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue and net profit figures highlight this upward trajectory. Quarterly Results: The consolidated quarterly financial results indicate a strong performance. title: Tata Motors share price falls 1.52%, Kotak Mahindra also among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in early trade, with the stock declining by 1.52%. At 9:25 am, the stock was trading at Rs 642.95. Other top losers on the Nifty 50 included Kotak Mahindra Bank and Jio Financial Services. Tata Motors Financial Highlights: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: Tata Motors' consolidated quarterly revenue has shown fluctuations over the past year. Revenue stood at Rs 119,503 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, nearly the same as Rs 119,986.31 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. The revenue was Rs 108,048.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024, Rs 101,450.00 Crore for the quarter ending September 2024 and Rs 113,575.00 Crore for the quarter ending December 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 8,442 Crore, down from Rs 17,282.04 Crore in the same quarter the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also decreased from Rs 45.42 to Rs 23.40 over the same period. Consolidated Yearly Performance: Tata Motors has demonstrated substantial revenue growth over the past five years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 439,695.00 Crore, slightly increased from Rs 437,927.77 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The revenue for year ending March 2023 was Rs 345,966.96 Crore, for year ending March 2022 was Rs 278,453.62 Crore and for year ending March 2021 was Rs 249,794.75 Crore. Net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 22,991.00 Crore, lower than the Rs 31,106.95 Crore reported for the year ending March 2024. The EPS also decreased from Rs 81.95 to Rs 78.80. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 242.90 in March 2024 to Rs 315.61 in March 2025. Key Financial Ratios: Tata Motors' return on equity (ROE) was 23.96% for the year ending March 2025, compared to 36.97% for the year ending March 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 1.16 in March 2024 to 0.54 in March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 439,695.00 CroreRs 437,927.77 CroreRs 345,966.96 CroreRs 278,453.62 CroreRs 249,794.75 CroreNet ProfitRs 22,991.00 CroreRs 31,106.95 CroreRs 2,353.49 CroreRs -11,234.70 CroreRs -13,016.14 CroreEPSRs 78.80Rs 81.95Rs 6.29Rs -29.88Rs -36.99BVPSRs 315.61Rs 242.90Rs 137.33Rs 127.50Rs 148.39ROE23.9636.975.32-25.67-24.34Debt to Equity0.541.162.773.132.08Kotak Mahindra: Kotak Mahindra Bank also saw a decline in early trade, contributing to the negative sentiment in the financial sector. Corporate Actions Tata Motors The board of directors of JLR approved the appointment of Mr. P B Balaji to succeed Mr. Adrian Mardell, as the CEO of JLR, when he retires upon completion of his contract. Mr. P B Balaji will be joining in this role from November 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share in May 2025, which was paid out on June 4, 2025. The company has a history of bonus issues, with the last one being on September 28, 1995, in the ratio of 3:5. Kotak Mahindra Kotak Mahindra announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share in May 2025, which was paid out on July 18, 2025. The company had a bonus issue on May 5, 2015, with existing ratio of 1 and offered ratio of 1. The stock was trading at Rs 642.95 and Kotak Mahindra was also among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index at 9:25 am.
summary_lexrank: Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 242.90 in March 2024 to Rs 315.61 in March 2025.
summary_luhn: The revenue was Rs 108,048.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024, Rs 101,450.00 Crore for the quarter ending September 2024 and Rs 113,575.00 Crore for the quarter ending December 2024.
summary_lsa: The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share in May 2025, which was paid out on June 4, 2025.
summary_textrank: The revenue was Rs 108,048.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024, Rs 101,450.00 Crore for the quarter ending September 2024 and Rs 113,575.00 Crore for the quarter ending December 2024.

title: Nifty 50 top gainers: Trent stock jumps 4.4%; Hero Moto, Bajaj Finserv, Titan among others leading the index today
content: Positive index contributors on the Nifty 50 include Trent, Hero Motocorp, Bajaj Finserv, Cipla and Titan Company as of 9:25 am on Thursday, August 7, 2025. Trent Trent is a top gainer on Nifty 50, trading at Rs 5,400, a gain of 4.35%. Financial Performance: The company's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. Here's a summary: Quarterly Performance: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,883.48 Crore, up from Rs 4,104.44 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 415.49 Crore, compared to Rs 335.61 Crore in June 2024. EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 12.09, up from Rs 11.04 in June 2024. Annual Performance: Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 17,134.61 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 12,375.11 Crore in March 2024. The revenue increased by 38.45 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,447.91 Crore, up from Rs 1,353.89 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased by 6.94 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 43.51, compared to Rs 41.82 in March 2024. BVPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 153.64, up from Rs 115.40 in March 2024. ROE for the year-ending March 2025 was 28.31%, down from 36.55% in March 2024. Debt to Equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 was 0.09, a decrease from 0.12 in March 2024. title: Hero Motocorp shares gain 1.35%, among top Nifty 50 gainers in early trade
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp were trading at Rs 4,535.30 in early trade, up by 1.35% from the previous close, as of 09:20 am. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index. On August 6, 2025, the company announced the approval of unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company has consistently rewarded investors with dividends. Recent dividends include a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) with an effective date of July 24, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) with an effective date of February 12, 2025. title: Jindal Stainless shares fall 6.15% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Jindal Stainless declined sharply in early trade, with the stock falling 6.15% to Rs 688.85. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The price movement represents a significant decrease from its previous close. On the financial front, Jindal Stainless has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 10,207.14 Crore, up from Rs 9,429.76 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 728.32 Crore, compared to Rs 647.50 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 7.87 to Rs 8.67. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 9,429.76 CroreRs 9,776.83 CroreRs 9,907.30 CroreRs 10,198.32 CroreRs 10,207.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 647.50 CroreRs 609.42 CroreRs 668.78 CroreRs 617.94 CroreRs 728.32 CroreEPS7.877.427.957.188.67 The company's annual performance also reflects strong financials. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 39,312.21 Crore, up from Rs 38,562.47 Crore in March 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 2,543.42 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 2,640.35 Crore recorded in the previous year. The EPS for the same period was Rs 30.42, compared to Rs 32.95 in the year prior. Below is the consolidated annual financial data for Jindal Stainless:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,188.46 CroreRs 21,223.40 CroreRs 35,697.03 CroreRs 38,562.47 CroreRs 39,312.21 CroreNet ProfitRs 414.25 CroreRs 1,806.44 CroreRs 1,973.87 CroreRs 2,640.35 CroreRs 2,543.42 CroreEPS8.6037.8125.6832.9530.42BVPS66.0599.46145.33174.56202.61ROE13.0736.2717.7218.8915.01Debt to Equity0.970.600.320.410.38 Furthermore, the company announced several updates under Regulation 30 (LODR), including investor presentations and press releases. Jindal Stainless had previously announced an interim dividend of Rs 1 per share (50%) with an effective date of February 7, 2025. Jindal Stainless shares are currently trading lower, with the stock priced at Rs 688.85 in Thursday's morning session.

title: Sensex falls for third straight day, Nifty below 24,550 as Trump threatens additional 25% tariff
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex slipped for a third session in a row on August 7 after US President Donald Trump announced plans to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent. However, markets may find some temporary relief as the fresh 25 percent levy comes with a 21-day window, giving India a brief opportunity to negotiate a trade deal. At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was down 209.33 points or 0.26 percent at 80,334.66, and the Nifty was down 64.15 points or 0.26 percent at 24,510.05. About 910 shares advanced, 1793 shares declined, and 122 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "The 21-day window before the additional 25 percent US tariff takes effect offers India a chance to negotiate and potentially strike a deal. However, the broader trade outlook remains clouded by uncertainty, with little clarity on how far either side is willing to compromise. President Trump, buoyed by recent trade wins with other partners like the EU, is unlikely to back down from his hardline — and arguably unjustified — stance." V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments Limited, said. "For India, the challenge is greater, as the US holds the upper hand in negotiations. So far, India’s response has been measured and pragmatic. While markets are unlikely to panic immediately, sentiment is expected to remain weak in the near term amid lingering trade tensions." he added. Among individual stocks, Bajaj Auto slipped as much as 4 percent on August 7 after the company reported a 14 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 2,210.44 crore for the fiscal first quarter of FY26. Revenue from operations climbed to Rs 13,133.35 crore in Q1 FY26, marking a 10 percent increase from the same quarter last year. Bernstein and CLSA have given outperform rating on the counter. Shares of lifestyle retailer Trent rose 1 percent after the company reported a 9 percent year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to Rs 425 crore for Q1FY26, compared to Rs 391 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue rose 19 percent YoY to Rs 4,883 crore from Rs 4,104 crore. Domestic brokerages Motilal Oswal and Avendus Spark have given buy ratings. Two-wheeler major Hero MotoCorp rose nearly 2 percent after it reported a flat net profit at Rs 1,126 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 as against Rs 1,123 crore a year ago. However, the firm beat estimates as a Moneycontrol poll of eight brokerage firms pegged the net profit at Rs 1,054 crore. Hero's revenue declined 5.5 percent to Rs 9,579 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 10,144 crore in Q1FY25. Technical View The Nifty continues to trade within a tightly knit consolidation range of 24,500–24,750, as evidenced by successive small-bodied candles on the daily chart. A directional breakout from this band will likely dictate the next phase of market momentum. Until then, the Nifty may continue its sideways to choppy trajectory. The 100-day exponential moving average (100-DEMA), currently near 24,595, has consistently acted as a support threshold. However, a decisive breakdown below the 24,535–24,500 zone could trigger further downside toward 24,300–24,250. On the upside, immediate resistance is seen around 24,760, coinciding with the 10-DEMA. Unless the index convincingly reclaims this level, any rebound is expected to encounter selling pressure. Hero MotoCorp, Trent, Cipla, Bajaj Finserv, and Tech Mahindra were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra, Jio Financial Services, Coal India, and Tata Steel. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Bharat Forge shares fall 2.5% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharat Forge declined by 2.5% to Rs 1,110.90 in early trade. At 9:17 am, the stock was trading lower on the Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Performance: Bharat Forge's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: The company's quarterly revenue has seen fluctuations. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.75 Crore, compared to Rs 3,852.60 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 287.14 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 284.90 Crore reported in the previous quarter. Earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5.93, marginally up from Rs 5.92 in the quarter-ending March 2025. On an annual basis, the company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,122.80 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 15,682.07 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 916.98 Crore from Rs 904.84 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 20.05, compared to Rs 20.43 for the year-ending March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20244,106.15173.894.36Sep 20243,688.51243.885.23Dec 20243,475.55214.324.54Mar 20253,852.60284.905.92Jun 20253,908.75287.145.93Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,336.26-96.99-2.71116.98-2.330.85202210,461.081,110.0823.23142.3216.460.86202312,910.26541.8311.35144.787.871.02202415,682.07904.8420.43153.8813.261.05202515,122.80916.9820.05193.5310.170.68The consolidated income statement provides further details, with sales for the year-ending March 2025 at Rs 15,122 Crore, compared to Rs 15,682 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 213 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. Total expenditure was Rs 13,459 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 1,877 Crore. After accounting for interest and tax, the net profit was Rs 916 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharat Forge has announced several corporate actions. On August 6, 2025, announcements were made regarding an analyst/investor meet and updates on acquisition. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 8, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (125%) was announced on February 12, 2025, with an effective date of February 18, 2025. The company has also had bonus issues and stock splits in its corporate history. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bearish sentiment on the stock as of today. Shares of Bharat Forge declined by 2.5% to Rs 1,110.90 in early trade.

title: Fortis Healthcare shares rise over 4% to hit 52-week high; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Fortis Healthcare reached new 52-week high and also all-time high of Rs 893 on the NSE in Thursday's session, jumping as much as 4% from the previous close. At 09:27 am, the stock was trading at Rs 885, positioning it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Fortis Healthcare's revenue has shown consistent growth over the past year. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,166.72 Crore, compared to Rs 1,858.90 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 263.86 Crore from Rs 173.39 Crore. Annually, the company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,782.75 Crore, up from Rs 6,892.92 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase, reaching Rs 797.86 Crore compared to Rs 635.71 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Fortis Healthcare show a basic EPS of Rs 10.26 and a diluted EPS of Rs 10.26 as of March 2025. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 118.11 as of the year-ending March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio stands at 0.25. title: CAMS interim dividend ex-date due Friday; last day today to buy for Rs 11 per share payout
content: CAMS (Computer Age Management Services) announced an interim dividend of ₹11.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 8, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. CAMS stock's last traded price was Rs 3,816.40, a 0.52% increase compared to its previous closing price. The interim dividend announcement provides an opportunity for investors to receive a portion of the company's earnings. Financial Performance Overview: CAMS has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past year. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 1,422.48 crore, a substantial increase from Rs 1,136.52 crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 464.70 crore compared to Rs 350.98 crore in the year ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 72.06 to Rs 95.41. Quarterly, CAMS reported a revenue of Rs 354.15 crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 331.40 crore in June 2024. title: ABB India ₹9.77 interim dividend ex-date due Friday; last day to buy today for eligibility
content: ABB India announced an interim dividend of ₹9.77 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 8, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. ABB India stock's last traded price was ₹5,097.00, a 0.26% increase compared to the previous day's close. This dividend announcement impacts shareholders looking for short-term returns, and the stock's performance may be influenced by investors reacting to this news.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹9.77Ex-DateAugust 8, 2025 (Due Tomorrow)ABB India, with a market capitalization of ₹1,080.09 Crore, has demonstrated varying financial performance over the past few years. Examining the historical financial data provides additional context for this dividend announcement. Financial Performance Overview: Quarterly Highlights: Reviewing consolidated quarterly revenue figures, ABB India reported ₹1,850.25 Cr in March 2019, ₹1,725.75 Cr in June 2019, ₹1,745.62 Cr in September 2019, ₹1,974.86 Cr in March 2022, and ₹2,097.85 Cr in June 2022. The net profit for these quarters was ₹116.19 Cr, ₹130.40 Cr, ₹135.28 Cr, ₹79.66 Cr, and ₹145.67 Cr, respectively. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) followed suit, with ₹5.48, ₹6.15, ₹6.38, ₹3.76, and ₹6.87 for the corresponding periods. Annual Highlights: The consolidated yearly revenue stood at ₹7,451.79 Cr in 2011 and ₹7,610.48 Cr in 2012. Net profit for these years was ₹184.71 Cr and ₹140.94 Cr, respectively. EPS was ₹8.72 and ₹6.65, while the Book Value Per Share (BVPS) was ₹119.61 and ₹122.78. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 7.28% and 5.41%, and the Debt to Equity ratio was 0.00 and 0.13 for 2011 and 2012, respectively. Income Statement Analysis: Analyzing the income statement on a yearly basis, ABB India's sales were ₹12,188 Cr in December 2024, ₹10,446 Cr in December 2023, ₹8,567 Cr in December 2022, ₹6,934 Cr in December 2021, and ₹5,820 Cr in December 2020. The corresponding Net Profits were ₹1,874 Cr, ₹1,248 Cr, ₹1,025 Cr, ₹532 Cr, and ₹230 Cr. On a quarterly basis, the sales figures were ₹3,175 Cr in June 2025, ₹3,159 Cr in March 2025, ₹3,364 Cr in December 2024, ₹2,912 Cr in September 2024, and ₹2,830 Cr in June 2024. The respective Net Profits were ₹351 Cr, ₹474 Cr, ₹528 Cr, ₹440 Cr, and ₹443 Cr. Cash Flow and Balance Sheet: The cash flow from operating activities in recent years was ₹1,331 Cr in December 2024, ₹1,351 Cr in December 2023, ₹741 Cr in December 2022, ₹649 Cr in December 2021, and ₹318 Cr in December 2020. The company’s share capital has remained constant at ₹42 Cr over the past few years. Reserves & Surplus stood at ₹7,032 Cr in December 2024. Financial Ratios: The Basic and Diluted EPS in December 2024 were ₹88.32, compared to ₹58.61 in December 2023. The Dividend per share in December 2024 was ₹44.16. Return on Networth/Equity stood at 26.45% in December 2024. Debt to Equity remains at 0.00 across the last five years. The interim dividend is a part of ABB India's ongoing corporate actions and will likely influence investor sentiment as the ex-date approaches. The stock's movement will be closely watched to gauge market reaction to this announcement, especially given its current price momentum and the broader financial context.

title: Nestle India 1:1 bonus ex-date due Friday; last day to trade today before stock turns ex-bonus
content: Nestle India's 1:1 bonus issue ex-date is due tomorrow -- Friday, 8 August 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-bonus; investors who hold the stock today will be eligible for the bonus shares. Nestle stock's last traded price was Rs 2,233.30, a decline of 1.50% compared to the previous day's close. The bonus issue means that shareholders will receive one additional share for each share they currently hold. Nestle's market capitalization stands at Rs 2,153,252.18 Crore. Financial Performance: Nestle's financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Performance: In the quarter ending June 2025, Nestle reported revenue of Rs 5,096.16 Crore and a net profit of Rs 659.23 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the same period was Rs 6.71. Comparatively, in the quarter ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 5,503.88 Crore with a net profit of Rs 885.88 Crore and an EPS of Rs 9.06. The quarter ending December 2024 saw revenue of Rs 4,779.73 Crore, net profit of Rs 695.82 Crore, and EPS of Rs 7.14. The September 2024 quarter showed revenue of Rs 5,104.00 Crore, net profit of Rs 903.21 Crore, and EPS of Rs 9.33. Finally, the June 2024 quarter recorded revenue of Rs 4,813.95 Crore, net profit of Rs 746.60 Crore, and EPS of Rs 7.74.Quarterly Financial Results (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Revenue5,096.165,503.884,779.735,104.004,813.95Net Profit659.23885.88695.82903.21746.60EPS6.719.067.149.337.74Annual Performance: Nestle's consolidated annual revenue for 2025 was Rs 20,201.56 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 3,231.54 Crore and an EPS of Rs 33.27. In 2024, the company reported revenue of Rs 24,393.89 Crore, a net profit of Rs 3,932.84 Crore, and an EPS of Rs 40.79. title: Bharat Electronics stock rises on Wednesday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharat Electronics were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 on Wednesday. The stock ended at Rs 389.70 in yesterday's session, a 0.79% increase. Financial Snapshot Bharat Electronics' financial performance shows consistent growth. title: Sensex, Nifty set to drop for third day as Trump’s additional 25% tariff rattles sentiment
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex are poised to extend losses for a third straight session after US President Donald Trump announced plans to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent. However, markets may find some temporary relief as the fresh 25 percent levy comes with a 21-day window, giving India a brief opportunity to negotiate a trade deal. At about 7:45 pm, the Gift Nifty was at 24,552, lower by 0.32 percent. After a choppy intraday session, bears drove Dalal Street into the red on August 6, as the Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee's decision failed to support the benchmark indices. Further, investors decided to trim exposure to the equity markets as U.S. President Trump's repeated tariff threats roiled sentiment. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) were net sellers to the tune of Rs 4,999 crore worth of shares in Indian equities, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) net bought Rs 6,794 crore worth of shares, according to provisional NSE data. Here are the key levels to watch out for in today's session The Nifty continues to trade within a tightly knit consolidation range of 24,500–24,750, as evidenced by successive small-bodied candles on the daily chart. A directional breakout from this band will likely dictate the next phase of market momentum. Until then, the Nifty may continue its sideways to choppy trajectory. The 100-day exponential moving average (100-DEMA), currently near 24,595, has consistently acted as a support threshold. However, a decisive breakdown below the 24,535–24,500 zone could trigger further downside toward 24,300–24,250. On the upside, immediate resistance is seen around 24,760, coinciding with the 10-DEMA. Unless the index convincingly reclaims this level, any rebound is expected to encounter selling pressure. Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities says that the Nifty Bank index is yet to stage a meaningful breakout, despite a Bullish Harami pattern forming on the daily chart. A reversal will only be confirmed if it closes above 55,700. Minor upticks continue to face selling pressure, keeping the trend weak. The index remains stretched below its short-term averages, with the 10-day EMA near 55,900 and the 20-day EMA around 56,200 acting as key resistance. On the downside, support lies at 55,100–55,000. A breach below this could trigger further selling toward 54,500–54,300, he added. India VIX rose marginally by 2.11 percent to close at 11.96. Despite upcoming macro triggers, volatility remains subdued and anchored near the 11 mark—suggesting that the broader market is currently pricing in consolidation rather than a steep correction. This implies that while caution prevails, panic has not yet taken hold. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) has sharply declined from 0.72 to 0.60, highlighting growing bearish sentiment and a clear dominance of call sellers. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a negative start today, tracking cues from GIFT Nifty was trading around 24,555 a short while ago this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Indian benchmark indices ended lower on second consecutive session on August 6 amid volatility after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) delivered on expected line, keeping key interest rates unchanged with 'neutral' stance. At close, the Sensex was down 166.26 points or 0.21 percent at 80,543.99, and the Nifty was down 75.35 points or 0.31 percent at 24,574.20. The BSE midcap and smallcap indices were down 1 percent each. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading lower at around 24,555, indicating a negative opening for the day. Asian Equities (Up) Asian shares climbed along with US equity-index futures as investors looked past President Donald Trump’s threat of a 100% tariff on chip exports to the US. Technology stocks jumped. US Equities (Up) US stocks ended higher on Wednesday, led by a more than 1% gain in the Nasdaq, as Apple shares climbed after news of its plans to announce a domestic manufacturing pledge, and as some companies delivered upbeat earnings reports. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 81.38 points, or 0.18%, to 44,193.12, the S&P 500 gained 45.87 points, or 0.73%, to 6,345.06 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 252.87 points, or 1.21%, to 21,169.42. US Bond Yield (Flat) The yield on 10-year Treasuries were up marginally at 4.23 percent and 2-year Treasuries were little change at 3.7 percent. Dollar Index (Flat) The dollar remained lower against major peers on Thursday, as expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts grew and concerns swirled about partisanship creeping into key U.S. institutions. Asian currencies (Higher) Asian currencies were trading mostly higher in the early Thursday trade, however, on month-to-date basis, except Malaysian Ringgit, all other currencies fell upto 3 percent. Crude (Gains) Oil prices rose on Thursday, pausing a five-day losing streak, on signs of steady demand in the U.S., the world's biggest oil user, though the prospect of U.S.-Russian talks on the Ukraine war eased concerns of supply disruptions from further sanctions. Gold (Up) Gold and Silver prices were trading higher at USD 3377 per ounce and around USD 38 per ounce respectively. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their selling in the month of August as they sold equities nearly Rs 5,000 crore on August 6, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 6,794 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead.
