title: No rate cut? Why the RBI’s ‘hawkish pause’ could still be good news for markets
content: The Reserve Bank of India’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept policy rates unchanged, delivering what economists may brand as a “hawkish pause.” At first glance, the decision may disappoint those hoping for rate relief. But its outlook for the next year certainly gives some reason to cheer. GDP growth projections for the current fiscal year were left unchanged, a move widely expected given the persistent global uncertainties. But surprise, surprise — the MPC pegged its forecast for the first quarter of FY27 at 6.6 percent, higher than the 6.5 percent projected for FY26. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates That signals stronger confidence in the economy’s momentum heading into next year. Inflation projections for FY26, on the contrary, have been cut to 3.1 percent from 3.7 percent earlier, though for the first quarter of next fiscal, it has been pegged at 4.9 percent. Most economists also feel inflation won’t stay down for too long and, in fact, depending on how Trump tariffs settle, there could be a risk of higher inflation — something the MPC recognises in its projections. So, here is the broad picture: if we have consumer inflation running at close to 5 percent, there is no case for the repo rate, which is already just a quarter percentage point above the projected inflation, to be cut much from hereon. Rates should at least cover inflation, so savers do not stand impoverished (not that we have not had long periods of negative “real rate” in the past!). More importantly, rate cuts are an ammo for central banks to trigger growth by making credit enticing for borrowers. And if growth is not suffering, there is no need to cut rates anyway. Also read: MPC meeting: RBI cuts FY26 inflation forecast to 3.1% from 3.7% At the same time, the reality today is that credit growth is in single digits, and that is not because credit is expensive but because there is fear and uncertainty on several counts. Apart from the risk of Trump tariffs — which will eventually determine if, when, and where private capex will come up — there is fear of AI-led job losses, which could hit a cohort that usually borrows the most: home loans, car loans, and durable loans. Besides visible stress in the microfinance and MSME segments, there is also the threat of stress rising in the MSME sector. That’s why RBI’s GDP growth forecast for the first quarter of next fiscal brings greater cheer. But, it does not take away the uncertainty. It is the mixed feeling that the bond markets showed some disappointment, with a modest uptick in yields — the 10‑year G‑sec rose from 6.33 to 6.37 percent. But stock markets hardly moved. Bank stocks were nonchalant about the MPC announcement, with leading banks clocking less than 1 percent gains today, for it strictly means no gains or losses for banks right away — there is no scope for treasury bounties, nor can the GDP growth projection be taken as a guarantee of better credit growth. The future is always uncertain, but in today’s business climate, there is a vast array of scenarios that could play out one year out. For now, strong growth and still‑firm inflation leave little reason to cut rates. But if the dust settles on Trump tariffs and the Fed also considers a rate cut, October could bring the first opening for a rate cut. For investors, the takeaway is that the RBI is holding back its firepower until it’s needed — and the prospect of easing later in the year may still be on the table. Till then, for stock markets, the focus will need to be on earnings, stock by stock.
summary_lexrank: That’s why RBI’s GDP growth forecast for the first quarter of next fiscal brings greater cheer.
summary_luhn: Also read: MPC meeting: RBI cuts FY26 inflation forecast to 3.1% from 3.7% At the same time, the reality today is that credit growth is in single digits, and that is not because credit is expensive but because there is fear and uncertainty on several counts.
summary_lsa: Most economists also feel inflation won’t stay down for too long and, in fact, depending on how Trump tariffs settle, there could be a risk of higher inflation — something the MPC recognises in its projections.
summary_textrank: For investors, the takeaway is that the RBI is holding back its firepower until it’s needed — and the prospect of easing later in the year may still be on the table.

title: Bharti Airtel shares trade flat; over 33.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,929.90 on the NSE at 12:20 pm, showing a marginal decline of 0.10% from the previous close. Over 33.4 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume for Bharti Airtel shares on the NSE reached 3,347,778. This level of trading activity suggests sustained investor interest in the stock. Recent Financial Performance The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators for Bharti Airtel:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26The revenue for Bharti Airtel has shown consistent growth over the quarters, with revenue increasing from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. The net profit saw a significant rise in December 2024 and March 2025 but decreased to Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) followed a similar trend, peaking in December 2024 and then declining in the subsequent quarters. All the values are consolidated for quarterly results. The following table provides an overview of Bharti Airtel's financial performance on an annual basis:Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The annual financial data indicates a strong growth trajectory for Bharti Airtel. Revenue increased consistently from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. Net profit, which was negative in 2021, turned positive and reached Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. The EPS also showed significant improvement, from -27.65 in 2021 to 58.00 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has been declining, indicating improved financial health. All the values are consolidated for yearly results. The following table presents the income statement on a yearly basis for Bharti Airtel:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 172,985 CroreRs 149,982 CroreRs 139,144 CroreRs 116,546 CroreRs 100,615 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,573 CroreRs 1,435 CroreRs 936 CroreRs 534 CroreRs 642 CroreTotal IncomeRs 174,558 CroreRs 151,417 CroreRs 140,081 CroreRs 117,081 CroreRs 101,258 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 118,109 CroreRs 118,800 CroreRs 104,972 CroreRs 90,405 CroreRs 100,563 CroreEBITRs 56,449 CroreRs 32,617 CroreRs 35,108 CroreRs 26,676 CroreRs 695 CroreInterestRs 21,753 CroreRs 22,647 CroreRs 19,299 CroreRs 16,616 CroreRs 15,091 CroreTaxRs 917 CroreRs 4,121 CroreRs 4,273 CroreRs 4,177 CroreRs 8,932 CroreNet ProfitRs 33,778 CroreRs 5,848 CroreRs 11,535 CroreRs 5,882 Crore-Rs 23,327 CroreThe sales for Bharti Airtel increased from Rs 100,615 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 172,985 Crore in March 2025. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) also showed a significant increase, from Rs 695 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 56,449 Crore in March 2025. Net profit improved substantially over the years, reaching Rs 33,778 Crore in March 2025 from a loss of Rs 23,327 Crore in March 2021. All the values are consolidated for yearly results. Corporate Actions Bharti Airtel announced the allotment of ESOP/ESPS under Regulation 30 (LODR) on August 5, 2025. The company's board concluded a meeting on August 5, 2025, where they approved the financial results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Prior dividends included Rs 8 per share (160%) announced on May 14, 2024, and Rs 4 per share (80%) announced on May 16, 2023. Conclusion At 12:20 pm, Bharti Airtel shares reflect a marginal dip, but the company exhibits robust financial health supported by increasing revenues and strategic corporate actions.

title: Buy JSW Energy; target of Rs 650: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on JSW Energy The company reported revenue of ₹51,434 million for the quarter ended June 2025, marking an 78.6% year-on-year increase from ₹28,795 million in the same quarter last year, and a growth of 61.3% rise on a sequential basis. The company reported EBITDA of ₹27,887 million and Profit After Tax (PAT) of ₹8,359 million for the June 2025 quarter. While EBITDA grew by 96.7% year-onyear, PAT grew by 56.5% over the same period. The company reported an EBITDA margin (EBIDTAM) of 54.2% and a profit after tax margin (PATM) of 16.3% in Q1 FY26, up from 49.2% whereas PATM was down from 18.6% respectively in the same quarter last year. Net generation rose 71% year-on-year to 13.5 BUs, supported by organic renewable energy (RE) capacity additions, contributions from O2 Power and the Mahanadi plant, along with higher output from Vijayanagar following a long-term tie-up. RE generation grew 54% YoY to 5.0 BUs, led by organic wind capacity additions and O2 Power, while thermal generation surged 83% YoY to 8.5 BUs, driven by increased contributions from Vijayanagar, Mahanadi, and Utkal plants. Long-term PPA generation also improved, rising 73% YoY to 11.8 BUs. Installed capacity increased to 12.8 GW with an addition of 1.9 GW during the quarter, including 1.3 GW from the O2 Power acquisition. One 80 MW unit of the 240 MW (3 x 80 MW) Kutehr hydro power plant was synchronized with the grid, with phase-wise synchronization and commissioning of the full project expected soon. During the quarter, the company signed PPAs for 605 MW (250 MW wind and 355 MW hybrid), and post-quarter end, additional PPAs were signed for 350 MW FDRE and 100 MW solar with a 100 MWh battery energy storage system (BESS). Outlook The management has given a full year FY26 capex guidance of ₹1,50,000 – 1,80,000 million. They have added capacities in various sectors such renewable energy, solar, wind etc. The company is developing a 20 MW floating solar plant in Karnataka along with setting up wind blade manufacturing facilities in western and southern India to improve supply chain efficiency. We maintain a BUY rating on the stock with an unchanged target price of ₹650 per share. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. JSW Energy - 06082025 - anand

title: Buy Escorts Kubota; target of Rs 3900: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Escorts Kubota Slightly above our estimated Rs3.12bn, Escorts’ Q1 EBITDA grew 3% y/y to Rs3.35bn due to better-than-expected agri-machinery margins (lowerthan-expected input/employee cost). We expect 8%/13% revenue/ EBITDA CAGRs over FY25-28 driven by a ramp-up in its non-vehicle revenue (a 17% CAGR), strong exports (35% volume CAGR) and gradually improved market share (over FY27/28). Key Vision 2028 strategies: new platforms for domestic/exports, component/R&D services exports, operating captive finance and ramping up plans for other segments. We introduce our FY28e, with 10/13/10% revenue/EBITDA/PAT growth. Outlook The stock trades at 27x/24x FY27e/28e core P/E. We retain a Buy with a Rs3,900 TP (earlier Rs3,900; 30x FY27e), 30x Sep’27e core EPS and Rs587/sh cash. title: Buy Marico; target of Rs 850: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Marico With a 9% rise in domestic volumes (vs. the Street’s 8%) and a 20.1% EBITDA margin (vs. 20.3% est.), Marico posted good revenue but a weaker operating performance. Management, though, was optimistic of high single digit volume growth, led by its core categories, GT revival via Project SETU, and new businesses. Also, with higher prices of Parachute (up 60%) and Saffola, management guided to >25% revenue growth in FY26, and doubledigit profit growth in two years. The price of copra have fallen 12% from its Jul peak, which along with price hikes should help gradual margin recovery in coming quarters. We introduce FY28 figures and raise our FY26e/27e EPS 4%/8% to factor in higher volumes, pricing and the VAHO revival. We turn bullish on the company on a) revival in its core portfolio aided by Project Setu, b) consistent volume delivery aided by digital brands & premium PC (22% of revenue) and c) potential cyclical margin reversion next year on the copra-price fall. Outlook Thus, we raise the stock to a Buy, with a higher 12-mth TP of Rs850, 47x Sep’27e EPS (earlier Rs710, 45x FY27e EPS). title: Buy Sumitomo Chemicals; target of Rs 690: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Sumitomo Chemicals Ahead of consensus & our estimates, Sumitomo’s Q1 was robust; revenue/ EBITDA/PAT grew 26/36/41% y/y. Key highlights: a) Domestic revenue up 29% y/y; exports 9% y/y. b) Exports subdued due to Europe, Africa, Asia, LATAM revenue down 37/6/16/37% y/y. c) Japan/NAFTA revenues were Rs317m/106m (nil a year back. d) The GM contracted 80bps y/y to 38.1% on pricing pressure in exports. e) The lower GM was fully absorbed by better operating leverage (employee cost down 110bps y/y; opex down 130bps y/y) leading to the EBITDA margin expanding 150bps y/y to 20.7%. f) Specialty/generics contributed 25%/75% (vs 24%/76% a year ago. g) Jun'25 WC:17 days fewer y/y to 43 (vs 60 a year ago, 89 the prior quarter) on 14 inventory days fewer y/y to 90. h) Cash collections were Rs13.3bn (Rs10.3bn last year). Outlook Factoring in Q1 FY26 results, we raise our FY26e/27e EPS 2/3%. We expect the company to clock 17/23% revenue/PAT CAGRs over FY25-28. We introduce FY28e and roll forward valuations to H1 FY28. We retain a Buy rating, with a higher TP of Rs690 (earlier Rs620), 40x H1 FY28e EPS. title: Sensex down 150 pts, Nifty below 24,600 as RBI keeps repo rate unchanged; all sectors in red
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex continued lower in afternoon trade on August 6, weighed down by broad-based sectoral weakness, after the Reserve Bank of India held interest rates steady amid rising global uncertainty triggered by US President Donald Trump’s renewed tariff threats. At about 12:10 pm, the Sensex was down 114.68 points or 0.14 percent at 80,595.57, and the Nifty was down 61.40 points or 0.25 percent at 24,588.15. About 966 shares advanced, 2461 shares declined, and 127 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "President Trump’s recent statements and policy actions are expected to keep market sentiment under pressure in the near term. India’s response so far has been restrained, but increasingly firm and calibrated. It's unlikely that India will yield to what are seen as unjustified demands from the US administration. This could result in some near-term economic headwinds, including a dip in exports and a slight downward revision in FY26 GDP growth — potentially around 6.2 percent, compared to the earlier estimate of 6.5 percent," V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments, said. "In its monetary policy announcement today, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5 percent, while maintaining a “neutral” policy stance. This comes despite rising global uncertainties, including the threat of potential US tariffs and ongoing geopolitical tensions. Significantly, the RBI retained its GDP growth forecast at 6.5 percent for FY26, citing robust domestic macroeconomic fundamentals. Inflation continues to remain well within the central bank’s comfort zone, with projections around 3 percent in FY25-26, well below the upper tolerance level," Aamar Deo Singh, VP of Research at Angel One, said. At mid-day, sectoral indices on the NSE were trading mostly in the red, reflecting broad-based weakness across the market. The Nifty Pharma index was among the top losers, down 1.61 percent, followed by Nifty Media and Nifty IT, which slipped 1.70 percent and 1.59 percent, respectively. Realty stocks also came under pressure, with the Nifty Realty index falling 2.17 percent. Other notable laggards included Nifty Consumer Durables (-1.24 percent), Nifty Midcap 100 (-1.21 percent), and Nifty Smallcap 100 (-1.52 percent). Auto, FMCG, Energy, and Metal indices also posted declines of around 0.7 to 0.9 percent. Banking indices fared relatively better, with Nifty Bank down 0.19 percent, Nifty PSU Bank slipping 0.36 percent, and Nifty Private Bank easing 0.24 percent. The India VIX, a gauge of market volatility, rose 1.88 percent to 11.93, indicating some nervousness among traders. Also read: MPC meeting: RBI cuts FY26 inflation forecast to 3.1% from 3.7% Indian pharmaceutical giants like Sun Pharma, Cipla, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, and Lupin, among others, saw steep cuts of up to 2 percent in the morning on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said he would sharply raise tariffs on imported medicines. In an interview with CNBC, Trump said the new duties would begin at a modest rate but could increase significantly over time. “We’ll be putting an initially small tariff on pharmaceuticals, but in one year, one-and-a-half years, maximum, it’s going to go to 150 percent and then 250 percent. Bharti Hexacom shares declined 4 percent on August 4 after global brokerage firm CLSA downgraded shares on to 'Underperform', following the Bharti Airtel unit's Q1 FY26 earnings report, which came in below expectations. Bharti Hexacom's revenue stood at Rs 2,260 crore, down 1 percent quarter-on-quarter, but up 18 percent year-on-year. Gland Pharma rose 4 percent after the company's profit after tax (PAT) for the quarter ended June stood at Rs 215 crore, up 50 percent from Rs 143 crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. Consolidated revenue from operations figures stood at Rs 1,505 crore in Q1FY26, as against Rs 1,401 crore reported in the year-ago period, marking a rise of 7 percent. Technical View Nifty once again failed to hold above the 24,700 mark in the morning session and spent most of the day oscillating near the 24,600 level, reflecting a cautious undertone. The index remains at a critical juncture and requires clearer direction in the coming sessions. Our view remains unchanged — holding above the key support level of 24,500 is essential to maintain the broader uptrend. A breach below this zone could trigger deeper selling, with the next major support seen around the 24,000 mark. Asian Paints, Trent, HUL, Adani Ports, and ICICI Bank were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included IndusInd Bank, Dr Reddy's, Tech Mahindra, Wipro, and Eternal. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Buy Dhanuka Agritech; target of Rs 1900: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Dhanuka Agritech Broadly in line with consensus and our estimates, Dhanuka Agritech’s Q1 revenue/EBITDA/PAT grew 7%/16%/14% y/y. Key highlights: a) Subdued revenue growth was largely due to lower offtake in cotton and soybean portfolio in the present kharif season on lower acreage in key regions. b) The gross margin expanded 130bps y/y to 36% led by superior product mix, c) lower opex (down 10bps y/y); incl. added reimbursement (Rs90m) in royalty from Bayer AG (for the two new products), resulted into expanding the EBITDA margin 120bps y/y to 15.7%, d) Rs30m EBITDA burn at Dahej in Q1. e) The Q1 innovationturnover index was 13.4% (19% in FY25), f) The company launched one 9(3) molecule, Dinkar (a paddy herbicide) in Q1, with promising feedback till now. g) Guided to higher double-digit revenue growth with a 100bp y/y drop in FY26e EBITDA margins. Outlook Expecting a normal monsoon, management guided to high double-digit revenue growth, with absolute EBITDA likely to be retained at the FY25 range. Further, it expects EBITDAM to decline 100bps y/y. It intends to launch eight 9(3) products. That said, we trim our FY26e/27e by 5% each. We introduce FY28e and roll forward valuations to H1 FY28. We maintain a Buy, with an unchanged TP of Rs1,900, 21x H1 FY28e EPS. title: Tata Elxsi share price falls 2% in Wednesday's trading session
content: Shares of Tata Elxsi declined by 2% to Rs 5,842 in Wednesday's trading session. The decline reflects bearish investor sentiment, according to a recent Moneycontrol analysis. Tata Elxsi is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Tata Elxsi's financial performance highlights are as follows:Standalone Income Statement (Annual):Key figures from the standalone annual income statement include:HeaderMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 3,729 CroreRs 3,552 CroreRs 3,144 CroreRs 2,470 CroreRs 1,826 CroreOther IncomeRs 179 CroreRs 121 CroreRs 73 CroreRs 44 CroreRs 39 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,908 CroreRs 3,674 CroreRs 3,218 CroreRs 2,515 CroreRs 1,865 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 2,860 CroreRs 2,605 CroreRs 2,264 CroreRs 1,760 CroreRs 1,348 CroreEBITRs 1,047 CroreRs 1,068 CroreRs 953 CroreRs 754 CroreRs 517 CroreInterestRs 18 CroreRs 20 CroreRs 16 CroreRs 9 CroreRs 5 CroreTaxRs 243 CroreRs 256 CroreRs 182 CroreRs 195 CroreRs 143 CroreNet ProfitRs 784 CroreRs 792 CroreRs 755 CroreRs 549 CroreRs 368 CroreThe sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,729 Crore compared to Rs 3,552 Crore in March 2024.Standalone Income Statement (Quarterly):Key figures from the standalone quarterly income statement include:HeaderJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 892 CroreRs 908 CroreRs 939 CroreRs 955 CroreRs 926 CroreOther IncomeRs 38 CroreRs 43 CroreRs 39 CroreRs 64 CroreRs 32 CroreTotal IncomeRs 930 CroreRs 951 CroreRs 979 CroreRs 1,019 CroreRs 958 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 729 CroreRs 725 CroreRs 718 CroreRs 715 CroreRs 701 CroreEBITRs 200 CroreRs 226 CroreRs 260 CroreRs 303 CroreRs 257 CroreInterestRs 4 CroreRs 4 CroreRs 4 CroreRs 4 CroreRs 4 CroreTaxRs 51 CroreRs 49 CroreRs 56 CroreRs 69 CroreRs 68 CroreNet ProfitRs 144 CroreRs 172 CroreRs 199 CroreRs 229 CroreRs 184 CroreThe sales for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 892 Crore compared to Rs 908 Crore in March 2025.Consolidated Financial Data:The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending March 2015 was Rs 231.28 Crore, compared to Rs 211.52 Crore for the quarter ending March 2014. The consolidated net profit for the quarter ending March 2015 was Rs 29.83 Crore, compared to Rs 21.85 Crore for the quarter ending March 2014. The consolidated EPS for the quarter ending March 2015 was Rs 9.58, compared to Rs 7.02 for the quarter ending March 2014. The consolidated revenue for the year ending 2015 was Rs 849.40 Crore, compared to Rs 774.79 Crore for the year ending 2014. The consolidated net profit for the year ending 2015 was Rs 102.02 Crore, compared to Rs 72.26 Crore for the year ending 2014. The consolidated EPS for the year ending 2015 was Rs 32.76, compared to Rs 23.21 for the year ending 2014. The book value per share for the year ending 2015 was Rs 91.02, compared to Rs 75.70 for the year ending 2014. The return on equity for the year ending 2015 was 35.99, compared to 30.65 for the year ending 2014. The debt to equity ratio for the year ending 2015 was 0.00, the same as the year ending 2014. Key Financial Ratios (Standalone):RatioMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021P/E (x)41.3861.2049.14100.1645.56P/B (x)11.3619.3417.8034.3912.40Tata Elxsi announced a final dividend of Rs 75 per share with an effective date of June 11, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 70 per share on June 25, 2024, and Rs 60.60 per share on June 22, 2023. On August 1, 2025, Tata Elxsi allotted 5,508 equity shares under its Performance Stock Option Plan 2023. Additionally, a press release on July 29, 2025, announced a strategic partnership with KAVIA AI. With the stock currently trading at Rs 5,842, Tata Elxsi has experienced a notable downturn in today's session.

title: Container Corporation of India shares decline 3.78% amid volume surge; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Container Corporation of India experienced a significant downturn, falling by 3.78% to Rs 557 at 11:53 am on Wednesday. This decline was accompanied by a surge in trading volume, positioning the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock's movement reflects a bearish sentiment, and it recorded one of its sharpest declines in recent trading sessions. This price reflects a decrease from the previous day's closing price. Financial Performance Container Corporation of India has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,887.02 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 8,653.41 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 1,259.70 Crore for the year ending March 2025, up from Rs 1,232.04 Crore in the year ending March 2024. The following table summarizes the key financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,427.08 CroreRs 7,652.73 CroreRs 8,169.12 CroreRs 8,653.41 CroreRs 8,887.02 CroreNet ProfitRs 469.30 CroreRs 1,028.37 CroreRs 1,152.33 CroreRs 1,232.04 CroreRs 1,259.70 CroreEPS8.2217.2719.2620.7121.20BVPS168.90178.18185.92195.74203.19ROE4.959.8110.4510.6610.40Debt to Equity0.010.010.000.000.00Additionally, the company's quarterly performance shows the following trends:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,103.13 CroreRs 2,287.75 CroreRs 2,208.31 CroreRs 2,287.83 CroreRs 2,153.63 CroreNet ProfitRs 260.24 CroreRs 371.25 CroreRs 340.52 CroreRs 287.69 CroreRs 259.13 CroreEPS4.266.016.034.913.51The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,153.63 Crore, slightly higher than Rs 2,103.13 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 259.13 Crore. Corporate Actions The board approved an interim dividend of Rs 1.60 per share, with a record date of August 13, 2025. The company announced a bonus issue on May 22, 2025, with a bonus ratio of 1:4 and an ex-bonus date of July 4, 2025. Valuation and Ratios Key financial ratios for Container Corporation of India include a P/E ratio of 26.10 and a P/B ratio of 3.40 as of March 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio stands at 0.00 for the year ending March 2025. Cash Flow The cash flow statement indicates that cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,711 Crore. The stock's movement reflects a bearish sentiment, as indicated by recent Moneycontrol analysis.

title: Tech Mahindra shares fall 2.01% in Wednesday's trading session
content: Shares of Tech Mahindra declined by 2.01% to Rs 1,455.60 in Wednesday's trading session, as of 11:28 am. This represents a notable decrease from its previous close. The stock is part of the NIFTY 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide an overview of Tech Mahindra's recent financial performance. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares fall 1.11% in today's session; over 3.8 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading lower in Wednesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 3,030, a decline of 1.11% on the NSE. Around 11:20 am, a traded volume of 383,849 shares was recorded. Financial Snapshot The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 63,437.00 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 64,479.00 Crore reported for the quarter ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 12,819.00 Crore, which is higher than the net profit of Rs 12,293.00 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The EPS increased from 33.79 in March 2025 to 35.27 in June 2025. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's revenue has consistently increased, reaching Rs 255,324.00 Crore in 2025 from Rs 164,177.00 Crore in 2021. EPS has risen from 86.71 in 2021 to 134.19 in 2025, and the Return on Equity (ROE) increased from 37.52% to 51.24% during the same period. The company maintained a zero debt-to-equity ratio across these years. title: Pharma stocks fall up to 2% as Trump threatens steep tariffs on drug imports
content: Indian pharmaceutical giants like Sun Pharma, Cipla, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, and Lupin, among others, saw steep cuts of up to 2 percent in the morning on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said he would sharply raise tariffs on imported medicines. In an interview with CNBC, Trump said the new duties would begin at a modest rate but could increase significantly over time. “We’ll be putting an initially small tariff on pharmaceuticals, but in one year, one-and-a-half years, maximum, it’s going to go to 150 percent and then 250 percent, because we want pharmaceuticals made in our country,” he said, without disclosing the starting tariff rate. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The remarks have added to fears of rising protectionism, particularly in critical sectors like healthcare and technology. Trump also indicated that tariffs on semiconductors and chips could be unveiled “next week or so,” although he did not share specifics. The US government has long sought to shift pharmaceutical manufacturing back to domestic soil, citing both economic and national security concerns. A formal review of the pharma sector is currently underway, with industry-specific tariffs under discussion — though there’s no clear timeline for when the findings will be released. At present, trade between the US and the European Union in pharmaceuticals and semiconductors is tariff-free under a bilateral framework. Should new import duties be implemented following the investigation, they would reportedly be capped at 15 percent under the terms of that agreement. Also read: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged with an eye on Trump's tariff threats The proposed tariffs could deliver a significant setback to the pharmaceutical industry, which has cautioned that such measures may inflate drug costs, discourage investment in the US, and disrupt supply chains — potentially putting patients at risk. Many drugmakers are already grappling with the effects of Trump’s drug pricing initiatives, which they argue threaten both profitability and their ability to fund research and innovation. In a fresh move last week, Trump sent letters to 17 pharmaceutical companies, urging them to commit to lowering drug prices in the US by September 29. Among the demands: offering their full portfolio of existing medicines to every Medicaid patient at the lowest price available in any developed country. Trump’s latest comments could weigh on sentiment for Indian drugmakers, which count the US as a key export market. As investors assess the risks of a shifting trade landscape, pharma counters may remain in focus in the days ahead. At about 11 am, the Nifty Pharma index was down 1.3 percent to 21,686. Divis Labs, Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's, Cipla, and Glenmark Pharma were the major laggards on the index. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: In an interview with CNBC, Trump said the new duties would begin at a modest rate but could increase significantly over time.
summary_luhn: Also read: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged with an eye on Trump's tariff threats The proposed tariffs could deliver a significant setback to the pharmaceutical industry, which has cautioned that such measures may inflate drug costs, discourage investment in the US, and disrupt supply chains — potentially putting patients at risk.
summary_lsa: Trump also indicated that tariffs on semiconductors and chips could be unveiled “next week or so,” although he did not share specifics.
summary_textrank: Also read: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged with an eye on Trump's tariff threats The proposed tariffs could deliver a significant setback to the pharmaceutical industry, which has cautioned that such measures may inflate drug costs, discourage investment in the US, and disrupt supply chains — potentially putting patients at risk.

title: Top Midcap Losers: Balkrishna Industries, Hitachi Energy, Concor stocks drag on Nifty Midcap 150 index today
content: In Wednesday's trading session, several stocks experienced notable declines, with Balkrishna Ind leading the downturn. At 10:30 am, Balkrishna Ind's stock was trading at Rs 2,460.50, a drop of 3.32% and Hitachi Energy was trading at Rs 20,675.00, a drop of 3.14%. These stocks were identified among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: Buy Capri Global Capital; target of Rs 229: LKP Research
content: LKP Research's research report on Capri Global Capital Capri Global Capital Ltd (CGCL) reported a robust performance in a seasonally weak quarter, supported by expanding margins, operating leverage, and consistent growth across all key business segments. In addition to its lending business, the company posted strong growth in non-interest income, which contributed 29% of total income. While asset quality saw a slight deterioration, it is expected to remain healthy, backed by technology-led underwriting and strong collection efficiency. Looking ahead, CGCL is expected to deliver a strong 26% AUM CAGR over FY25–FY27E, driven by its expanding presence in southern markets, a strong capital base, and growing co-lending partnerships. Moreover, accelerating income growth and operating leverage are likely to drive profitability, with RoA and RoE estimated at 3.7% and 14.8%, respectively, by FY27E. Outlook Hence, we maintain our BUY rating on the stock, based on 2.7x FY27E BVPS, with a revised target price of ₹229. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Capri Global Capital - 06082025 - lkp

title: Nifty Top Gainers: Trent, Asian Paints stocks lead gains on Nifty 50 in today's trading session
content: In Wednesday's trading session, several stocks demonstrated notable performance, securing positions among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. At 10:30 am, Trent led the gains at Rs 5,400.00, marking a 1.55% increase. Asian Paints followed, trading at Rs 2,473.20 with a 1.49% gain. Kotak Mahindra saw a rise to Rs 2,020.20, up by 0.86%, while Bharti Airtel was up 0.66% at Rs 1,944.50, and Bharat Electronics recorded a 0.65% increase, trading at Rs 389.15. Trent Financial Overview Trent's financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 17,134.61 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 12,375.11 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 1,447.91 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,353.89 Crore in March 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 41.82 in 2024 to Rs 43.51 in 2025. The company’s book value per share (BVPS) has steadily increased over the years, reaching Rs 153.64 in March 2025, up from Rs 115.40 in March 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 28.31% in March 2025, slightly lower than the 36.55% recorded in March 2024. Trent has also managed to reduce its debt-to-equity ratio from 0.12 in 2024 to 0.09 in 2025. Trent has also clarified on volume movement in the company's shares. Trent announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (500%) effective June 12, 2025. Other dividends include Rs 3.20 per share (320%) effective May 22, 2024, and Rs 2.20 per share (220%) effective May 25, 2023. Trent has issued multiple bonus shares, including a 1:1 ratio on October 22, 1996. The company has also announced multiple rights issues, including a 4:9 ratio on July 8, 2010. Trent executed a stock split on September 12, 2016, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 1. Asian Paints: The company has renewed its Joint Venture agreements with PPG Group, USA, and will participate in Non-Deal Roadshows. Other dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 4.25 per share (425%) effective November 19, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 28.15 per share (2815%) effective June 11, 2024. Asian Paints has issued multiple bonus shares, including a 1:2 ratio on August 22, 2003. The company executed a stock split on July 30, 2013, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 1. Kotak Mahindra: The company has released the Scrutinizer's Report and Earnings Call Transcript. Kotak Mahindra announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) effective July 18, 2025. Other dividends include Rs 2.00 per share (40%) effective July 19, 2024 and Rs 1.50 per share (30%) effective August 4, 2023. Kotak Mahindra has issued multiple bonus shares, including a 1:1 ratio on July 8, 2015. The company has also announced multiple rights issues, including a 1:4 ratio on January 31, 2000. Kotak Mahindra executed a stock split on September 13, 2010, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 5. Bharti Airtel: Bharti Airtel has announced the allotment of ESOP/ESPS and released its financial results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025. Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) effective July 18, 2025. Other dividends include Rs 8.00 per share (160%) effective August 7, 2024 and Rs 4.00 per share (80%) effective August 11, 2023. The company has also announced multiple rights issues, including a 1:14 ratio on September 27, 2021. Bharti Airtel executed a stock split on July 24, 2009, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 5. Bharat Elec: Bharat Elec has announced its book closure and released its Business Responsibility and Sustainability Reporting (BRSR) for FY 2024-25, along with its Integrated Annual Report for FY 2024-25. Bharat Elec announced an interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) effective March 11, 2025. Other dividends include a final dividend of Rs 0.80 per share (80%) effective August 14, 2024, and an interim dividend of Rs 0.70 per share (70%) effective March 22, 2024. Bharat Elec has issued multiple bonus shares, including a 2:1 ratio on September 15, 2022. Bharat Elec executed a stock split on March 16, 2017, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 1. With the stocks of Trent, Asian Paints, Kotak Mahindra, Bharti Airtel and Bharat Elec showing positive movement, investors are closely monitoring these Nifty 50 stocks for further gains in today's session.

title: Nifty Top Losers: Cipla, Sun Pharma, Infosys stocks drag on Nifty 50 in today's trading
content: Several stocks experienced declines in Wednesday's trading session, with Cipla, Sun Pharma, and Infosys among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At 10:30 am, Cipla's stock was trading at Rs 1,479.80, reflecting a 1.33% decrease from its previous close. Sun Pharma's stock was trading at Rs 1,611.60, down by 1.26% from its previous close, while Infosys was trading at Rs 1,442.60, a 1.21% decline from its previous close. Other stocks that experienced notable declines include Wipro, which fell by 1.2% to Rs 242.95, and Tech Mahindra, which decreased by 1.19% to Rs 1,467.70. Cipla Financial Performance: Cipla's consolidated financial performance shows consistent revenue and net profit growth over the past few years. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 27,547.62 Crore, compared to Rs 25,774.09 Crore for the year ending March 2024, representing a 6.88% increase. The net profit for the same period increased significantly, from Rs 4,155.31 Crore in 2024 to Rs 5,291.05 Crore in 2025, a 27.33% rise. The company's quarterly performance also reflects steady growth. For the quarter ending June 2025, Cipla's revenue stood at Rs 6,957.47 Crore, compared to Rs 6,693.94 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,292.05 Crore, up from Rs 1,176.29 Crore. Key financial ratios for Cipla indicate a strong financial position. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year ending March 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) was 16.90% for the year ending March 2025, compared to 15.43% for the previous year. title: Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals shares fall 2.24% in early trade
content: Shares of Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals declined by 2.24% to Rs 124.08 in Wednesday's early trading session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. In terms of quarterly results, Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals announced its consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 at Rs 17,356.23 Crore, compared to Rs 23,247.02 Crore in June 2024. The company reported a net loss of Rs 271.97 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025, while it earned a net profit of Rs 65.57 Crore in June 2024. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 24,595.87 Crore, a rise compared to the revenue of Rs 21,870.86 Crore reported for the quarter ending December 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending March 2025 was Rs 363.14 Crore, in comparison to a net profit of Rs 304.19 Crore for the quarter ending December 2024. Examining the yearly performance, the consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 94,681.62 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 90,406.68 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 28.08 Crore, a steep decline compared to Rs 3,582.44 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals as of March 2025 include a P/E ratio of 420.13 and a P/B ratio of 1.82. The company's debt to equity ratio was 0.99 for the year ending March 2025. In corporate actions, the company announced that the effective date for the final dividend of Rs 2 per share (20%) was August 9, 2024. Another interim dividend of Rs 1 per share (10%) had an effective date of February 2, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock.

title: Coromandel International shares fall 2.14% in morning trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Coromandel International declined by 2.14% to Rs 2,562.90 in Wednesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. This price movement reflects a change from the previous close. Financial Performance: Coromandel International's financial performance reveals the following trends based on consolidated data: The company's revenue and net profit have shown variance across the recent quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,042.30 Crore, up from Rs 4,728.83 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 501.63 Crore, compared to Rs 324.67 Crore for the corresponding period last year. On an annual basis, the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 24,085.24 Crore, an increase from Rs 22,058.39 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,108.15 Crore, up from Rs 1,667.17 Crore in the previous year.Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,728.83 CroreRs 7,432.83 CroreRs 6,935.19 CroreRs 4,988.39 CroreRs 7,042.30 CroreNet ProfitRs 324.67 CroreRs 671.99 CroreRs 516.39 CroreRs 595.10 CroreRs 501.63 CroreEPS10.5722.5717.3919.7017.15Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 14,181.95 CroreRs 19,110.85 CroreRs 29,627.91 CroreRs 22,058.39 CroreRs 24,085.24 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,323.75 CroreRs 1,524.72 CroreRs 2,037.43 CroreRs 1,667.17 CroreRs 2,108.15 CroreEPS45.3452.0968.5155.8170.23BVPS175.55216.64268.97320.88376.37ROE25.8024.0325.4517.4318.63Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.010.02Corporate Actions: Coromandel International has announced several corporate actions, including dividend payouts. A final dividend of Rs 6 per share (600%) was announced on April 30, 2025, with an effective date of July 17, 2025. Additionally, a special dividend of Rs 3 per share (300%) was announced on May 1, 2025, also effective from July 17, 2025. Prior to these, an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share was declared on January 31, 2025, effective from February 5, 2025. The company had splits and bonus issues in past. The company announced the split on October 19, 2010 where old face value was Rs 2 and new face value was Rs 1. The exsplit date for the same was December 23, 2010 and record date was December 24, 2010. The company announced the split on October 18, 2005 where old face value was Rs 10 and new face value was Rs 2. The exsplit date for the same was January 02, 2006 and record date was January 09, 2006. The company announced the bonus issue on October 11, 1986 where existing ratio was 2 and offered ratio was 1, where bonus ratio was 1:2. The company announced the bonus issue on August 11, 1978 where existing ratio was 5 and offered ratio was 3, where bonus ratio was 3:5. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 6, 2025.

title: Gujarat Fluorochemicals shares surge 2.02%, among top midcap gainers with high volume in today's session
content: Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited shares demonstrated notable activity in Wednesday's trading session, gaining 2.02%. The stock price reached Rs 3,566.70 at 10:05 am, marking a substantial move that positioned it among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. This increase was accompanied by high volume, suggesting strong investor interest in the counter. Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited has shown consistent financial performance over the recent years. The consolidated annual revenue increased from Rs 4,280.82 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 4,737.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also saw an increase, rising from Rs 434.96 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 546.00 Crore in March 2025. The company's EPS increased from Rs 39.60 in 2024 to Rs 49.69 in 2025. The company’s book value per share (BVPS) also improved, reaching Rs 659.36 in March 2025, up from Rs 540.40 in March 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) stood at 7.52% as of March 2025, slightly up from 7.32% in the previous year. The Debt to Equity ratio remained stable at 0.27 as of March 2025. title: Emami share price falls 2% in Wednesday's trading session; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Emami declined by 2% to Rs 601.70 in Wednesday's trading session. The fall positions the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Results: Emami's consolidated quarterly revenue saw fluctuations over the past year. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 906.07 Crore, which decreased to Rs 890.59 Crore in September 2024. It then increased to Rs 1,049.48 Crore in December 2024, before slightly decreasing to Rs 963.05 Crore in March 2025. The most recent quarter, June 2025, showed a revenue of Rs 904.09 Crore. Net profit also varied, starting at Rs 152.70 Crore in June 2024, rising to Rs 215.61 Crore in September 2024, and peaking at Rs 283.48 Crore in December 2024. It then decreased to Rs 162.76 Crore in March 2025, and slightly increased to Rs 166.37 Crore in June 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, starting at Rs 3.50 in June 2024, rising to Rs 4.87 in September 2024, and reaching Rs 6.39 in December 2024. It then decreased to Rs 3.72 in March 2025, and slightly increased to Rs 3.76 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 906.07 CroreRs 890.59 CroreRs 1,049.48 CroreRs 963.05 CroreRs 904.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 152.70 CroreRs 215.61 CroreRs 283.48 CroreRs 162.76 CroreRs 166.37 CroreEPS3.504.876.393.723.76Consolidated Yearly Results: Emami's consolidated yearly revenue has shown a steady increase over the past five years. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares fall 0.58% in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading lower in Wednesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 3,046.20, a 0.58% decrease from the previous close, as of 10:00 am. Financial Overview: Tata Consultancy Services' financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,324 Crore, compared to Rs 240,893 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 48,797 Crore, up from Rs 46,099 Crore in March 2024. The company’s revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 63,437 Crore, while the net profit for the same period stood at Rs 12,819 Crore. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 62,613 Crore and the net profit was Rs 12,105 Crore. Key financial ratios for Tata Consultancy Services include a P/E ratio of 26.87 and a P/B ratio of 13.77 as of March 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00 for the year ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial data:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 255,324 CroreRs 240,893 CroreRs 225,458 CroreRs 191,754 CroreRs 164,177 CroreNet ProfitRs 48,797 CroreRs 46,099 CroreRs 42,303 CroreRs 38,449 CroreRs 32,562 CroreEPS134.19125.88115.19103.6286.71BVPS261.76252.26249.20245.48235.43ROE51.2450.7346.6142.9937.52Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Tata Consultancy Services announced a dividend of Rs 11 per share (1100%) as an interim dividend on June 27, 2025, with the effective date being July 16, 2025. Furthermore, the company had announced a final dividend of Rs 30 per share (3000%) on April 11, 2025, which was effective from June 4, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 6, 2025. With the stock currently priced at Rs 3,046.20, Tata Consultancy Services is trading lower in today's session.

title: Waaree Energies shares rise 2.06% in morning trade
content: Shares of Waaree Energies gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 3,119.00 in Wednesday's session. The company's recent financial performance shows a mix of growth and stability. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,425.83 Crore, up from Rs 3,408.90 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 772.89 Crore, compared to Rs 401.13 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 25.94 in June 2025 from Rs 14.98 in June 2024. The company's annual financial performance also reflects strong growth. Consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 14,444.50 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 11,397.61 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,928.13 Crore, up from Rs 1,274.38 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also rose, from Rs 48.05 in March 2024 to Rs 68.24 in March 2025. title: Larsen & Toubro shares decline marginally in today's session; over 1.6 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,644 on the NSE at 10:20 am, a marginal decline of 0.24% from the previous close. Over 1.6 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume for Larsen & Toubro shares on the NSE reached 164,708. Recent Financial Performance Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 26.30, versus Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, up from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, compared to Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 109.36, versus Rs 93.96 in March 2024. The net profit also increased from Rs 15,569 Crore to Rs 17,687 Crore during the same period. Key financial figures from the company's quarterly income statement are presented in the table below (all figures in Rs Crore):Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales63,67874,39264,66761,55455,119Other Income1,3561,1359671,101920Total Income65,03575,52765,63562,65556,040Total Expenditure58,39466,76759,45956,21650,502EBIT6,6418,7596,1756,4395,538Interest781745842884861Tax1,5331,8801,3321,4421,236Net Profit4,3256,1334,0014,1123,440The sales of Larsen & Toubro increased from Rs 55,119 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 63,678 Crore in June 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 3,440 Crore to Rs 4,325 Crore during the same period. The company's cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,160 Crore, compared to Rs 18,266 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The balance sheet shows that the total assets of Larsen & Toubro were Rs 379,524 Crore as of March 2025, compared to Rs 339,627 Crore as of March 2024. Key financial ratios for Larsen & Toubro show a P/E ratio of 31.93 and a P/B ratio of 4.92 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.33 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Larsen & Toubro announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share with effective date of June 03, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 28 was announced with effective date of June 20, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue announced on May 29, 2017, in the ratio of 1:2. Market Outlook & Investor Sentiment According to a Moneycontrol analysis as of July 30, 2025, the sentiment for Larsen & Toubro is bullish. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,644, Larsen & Toubro has seen a marginal decline in today's session, with over 1.6 lakh shares traded.

title: Glenmark Pharma share price falls 2.01% in Wednesday's trading session
content: Shares of Glenmark Pharma declined by 2.01% to trade at Rs 2,011.30 on Wednesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's recent financial performance shows a mix of results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,256.21 Crore, compared to Rs 3,062.95 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit for the same period was Rs 4.38 Crore, a significant decrease compared to Rs 340.24 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024 and a sharp contrast to the loss of Rs 1,214.27 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 0.16. Analysing the yearly data, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 13,321.74 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 11,813.10 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,047.14 Crore, recovering from a loss of Rs 1,830.85 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 37.11, compared to a negative EPS of Rs -53.22 in March 2024. title: Buy Varun Beverages; target of Rs 588: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Varun Beverages In Q2CY25, consolidated revenue stood at INR 70,174 Mn., down 2.5% YoY (+26.1% QoQ), sharply below our estimates, as the overall volumes were impacted by early onset of monsoons and erratic rain patterns in India. EBITDA stood flat YoY (+58.1% QoQ) at INR 19,988 Mn., below our estimates (-3.1%), led by subdued volume offtake in domestic business. EBITDA margin expanded by 82bps YoY (+578bps QoQ) to 28.5%, driven by improved forex realization and lower other expenses on account of operational efficiencies. Net profit stood at INR 13,170 Mn (+5.1% QoQ/+81.3% YoY), in line with our estimates, driven by operational efficiencies, higher other income (+75.3% YoY), and lower interest cost (-71.7% YoY). Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value VBL at 49.0x June-27 EPS (~ -1SD to 1-year avg. NTM P/E), implying a target price of INR 588. The stock is currently trading at 56.5x/48.0x based on CY25E/CY26E EPS estimates. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Varun Beverages - 06082025 - deven

title: DLF share price falls 2.09% in morning trade
content: Shares of DLF experienced a decline of 2.09% in Wednesday's session, trading at Rs 764.60. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. DLF's recent financial performance reveals key insights into its growth and profitability. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 7,993.66 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 6,427.00 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,694.51 Crore, substantially higher than the Rs 1,630.42 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 17.64, compared to Rs 11.02 in the previous fiscal year. title: Adani Ports share price rises 1.55%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: In Wednesday's session, Adani Ports gained 1.55%, trading at Rs 1,379.20 and emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Other notable gainers on the Nifty 50 included Trent, HDFC Life, Asian Paints and Bharti Airtel at 10:00 am. The company has seen consistent growth in its financials over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 31,078.60 Crore, up from Rs 26,710.56 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 10,919.70 Crore, compared to Rs 8,265.68 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 37.55 to Rs 51.35. Here is a more detailed look at Adani Ports' consolidated financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202112,549.605,063.0124.58157.0416.401.13202215,934.034,602.3922.39182.1512.411.19202320,851.915,344.9724.58216.4511.691.09202426,710.568,265.6837.55251.7315.360.87202531,078.6010,919.7051.35288.2617.810.73The company’s quarterly performance also reflects strong financials. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 9,126.14 Crore, up from Rs 7,559.59 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter stood at Rs 3,153.30 Crore, slightly down from Rs 3,184.39 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS was reported at Rs 15.34, compared to Rs 14.41 in the same period last year.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20247,559.593,184.3914.41Sep 20247,067.022,414.0111.32Dec 20247,963.552,467.0411.67Mar 20258,488.442,854.2613.95Jun 20259,126.143,153.3015.34Adani Ports has consistently rewarded its investors with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.00 per share (350%) on May 2, 2025, which was effective from June 13, 2025. Prior to this, dividends of Rs 6.00, Rs 5.00, Rs 5.00 and Rs 5.00 were announced in 2024, 2023, 2022 and 2021 respectively. The company's board met on August 5, 2025, to discuss various matters. Additionally, the company announced an investor group intimation and provided an audio recording of the analysts/investors call pertaining to the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. A stock split was announced on May 17, 2010, with an ex-split date of September 23, 2010, where the face value was split from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Adani Ports is currently trading among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, reflecting positive investor sentiment.

title: Ipca Laboratories share price falls 2% in morning trade
content: Shares of Ipca Laboratories declined 2% to Rs 1,398.40 in Wednesday's session. At 10:08 am, the stock witnessed selling pressure and was trading lower compared to its previous close. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. title: Hindustan Unilever shares gain marginally in morning trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading higher in Wednesday's session. At 10:00 am, the stock was priced at Rs 2,542.40 on the NSE, reflecting a gain of 0.30% from the previous close. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Hindustan Unilever:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514.00 Crore, compared to Rs 15,707.00 Crore in the quarter ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 2,769.00 Crore, up from Rs 2,614.00 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 11.73, compared to Rs 11.11 for the quarter ending June 2024. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance of Hindustan Unilever:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 increased to Rs 63,121.00 Crore from Rs 61,896.00 Crore in the year ending March 2024. Net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 10,679.00 Crore, compared to Rs 10,286.00 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 43.74 in March 2024 to Rs 45.32 in March 2025. The company’s Return on Equity (ROE) stood at 21.55% for the year ending March 2025, up from 20.06% in the year ending March 2024. Hindustan Unilever reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 for the year ending March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) were announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company has also announced audio video recording of earnings call held on July 31st, 2025. Hindustan Unilever had a stock split on July 3, 2000, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,542.40, Hindustan Unilever has shown a marginal gain in today's session.

title: Bharti Airtel shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, rise 0.64%
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading higher in Wednesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,944.20, a 0.64% increase from the previous close. The stock was identified as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 10:10 am. Financial Highlights: The financial performance of Bharti Airtel showcases consistent growth in revenue and fluctuating net profit over the past few years. Here's an overview based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Performance: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 for June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26Annual Performance: The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, with Rs 33,778.30 Crore reported for March 2025 compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for March 2025 was Rs 58.00.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13Income Statement: The consolidated income statement for the year-ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 172,985 Crore and other income of Rs 1,573 Crore, resulting in a total income of Rs 174,558 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 118,109 Crore, with earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) at Rs 56,449 Crore. Interest expenses were Rs 21,753 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 917 Crore, leading to a net profit of Rs 33,778 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow statement for the year-ending March 2025 indicates cash flow from operating activities at Rs 98,332 Crore, investing activities at Rs -60,269 Crore, and financing activities at Rs -36,533 Crore. The net cash flow stood at Rs 1,600 Crore. Balance Sheet: As of March 2025, the balance sheet shows a share capital of Rs 2,900 Crore and reserves and surplus of Rs 128,275 Crore. Current liabilities were Rs 180,440 Crore, and other liabilities were Rs 202,744 Crore, resulting in total liabilities of Rs 514,360 Crore. The assets included fixed assets of Rs 347,769 Crore, current assets of Rs 67,588 Crore, and other assets of Rs 99,001 Crore, with total assets matching the total liabilities at Rs 514,360 Crore. Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharti Airtel's board approved the grant of stock options, as per the announcement made on August 5, 2025. The company had also announced its financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, on the same day. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with the effective date as July 18, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,944.20, Bharti Airtel is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: IRCTC gets RBI's in-principle nod to act as online payment aggregator
content: The RBI has granted an in-principle approval to IRCTC Payments, a subsidiary of online railway ticketing platform IRCTC, to act as an online payment aggregator, the company informed through an exchange filing, sending the shares higher on August 6 by over a percent. "..Reserve Bank of India (RBI), vide its letter dated August 04, 2025 (received via email dated August 05, 2025), has granted ‘In-Principle’ authorization to IRCTC Payments Limited, a Wholly Owned Subsidiary of IRCTC, to operate as an Online Payment Aggregator under the Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007," the statement said. IRCTC Payments is a wholly owned subsidiary of IRCTC and was formed to cater to the payment aggregator business. Post the in-principle approval, IRCTC will have to wait for the final approval, which the company said in June could take around a year. IRCTC Payments was incorporated in February 2024 as a wholly owned subsidiary, and the parent entity had submitted application seeking in-principle approval from RBI in December 2024, post which certain clarification was sought, which the company had provided. Brokerage Investec in a recent note said it sees a 66 percent upside in the stock and has recommended a Buy call with a target price of Rs 1200 per share. Through the subsidiary, IRCTC is hoping to diversify into the payment gateway and payment aggregator business which it hopes will streamline its e-ticketing services. IRCTC i-Pay, the payment aggregator facilitates payments through all modes such as internet banking, debit and credit card, wallets, UPI and Autopay, In FY24, i-Pay generated a revenue of Rs 114.54 crore at a growth of 19.33 percent compared to a year ago. The subsidiary also issues pre-paid instruments such as cash and gift cards, manages coupons and loyalty cards, and operates as a Bharat bill payment unit. The entity also develops payment processing software and fintech solutions to support e-commerce activities of the parent. Q4FY25 saw IRCTC's internet ticketing revenue rise to Rs 372.5 crore at a strong 8.78 percent on-year growth, with a record revenue milestone of Rs 1,269 crore for the company.
summary_lexrank: IRCTC Payments is a wholly owned subsidiary of IRCTC and was formed to cater to the payment aggregator business.
summary_luhn: The RBI has granted an in-principle approval to IRCTC Payments, a subsidiary of online railway ticketing platform IRCTC, to act as an online payment aggregator, the company informed through an exchange filing, sending the shares higher on August 6 by over a percent.
summary_lsa: "..Reserve Bank of India (RBI), vide its letter dated August 04, 2025 (received via email dated August 05, 2025), has granted ‘In-Principle’ authorization to IRCTC Payments Limited, a Wholly Owned Subsidiary of IRCTC, to operate as an Online Payment Aggregator under the Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007," the statement said.
summary_textrank: The RBI has granted an in-principle approval to IRCTC Payments, a subsidiary of online railway ticketing platform IRCTC, to act as an online payment aggregator, the company informed through an exchange filing, sending the shares higher on August 6 by over a percent.

title: Adani Ports shares jump 2% after firm's Q1 net profit rises 7%: Should you buy, sell or hold?
content: Adani Ports shares jumped nearly 2 percent in early trade on August 6, a day after the company released its results for the first quarter of the financial year 2026. Brokerages remain bullish on the stock, with target prices implying strong upside potential from current levels. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) on August 5 reported a net profit of Rs 3,315 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a 6.5 percent on-year rise from the Rs 3,113 crore net profit reported in Q1 FY25. This is higher than the MC poll estimate of Rs 2,985.40 crore. The firm's revenue from operations meanwhile rose 31 percent year-on-year to Rs 9,126.14 crore, also beating MC poll estimate of Rs 8,768.10 crore. Along with the Q1 results, Adani Ports announced that its board has approved the redesignation of Gautam Adani as a Non-Executive Chairman of the company, from his current role as an Executive Chairman. He thereby ceased to be a key managerial personnel of the company effectively from August 5. Speaking about its Haifa port in Israel, the company said that it operated unhindered throughout, despite significant uncertainties during the rising tensions between Israel and Iran during the quarter under review. "Haifa port operated unhindered throughout and reported 25% YoY growth in container volume and 38% YoY growth in other cargo volume during the quarter, leading to overall volume growth of 29% YoY. This led to the highest quarterly revenue and operating EBITDA for Haifa port since acquisition by APSEZ," said Adani Ports in its press release. After the release of the results, the shares of the company dropped nearly 2 percent to close at Rs 1,362 apiece on August 5. However, brokerages remain bullish on the stock. Should you buy, sell or hold? CLSA has maintained an 'Outperform' rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,764 apiece. This implies an upside potential of nearly 30 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage noted that the firm's Q1 traffic was up 11 percent on-year, and it maintained its robust FY26 guidance. The Adani Group company implied an EBITDA growth of 14-20 percent on-year, despite a hazy global trade picture, it added. CLSA said that the firm's EBITDA margin improved on the back of price hikes, a better cargo mix and rupee depreciation. Jefferies kept a 'Buy' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,815 per share. This implies an upside potential of more than 33 percent from the stock’s previous closing price. The international brokerage noted that the firm’s quarterly EBITDA was above estimates, while management reiterated its focus on absolute EBITDA growth. Motilal Oswal Financial Services also kept a ‘Buy’ call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,700 apiece. This implies an upside potential of nearly 25 percent from the stock’s previous closing price. The domestic brokerage noted that the firm’s revenue growth was in line with its estimate, while EBITDA and APAT beat expectations. “APSEZ reported a strong performance in 1QFY26, marked by robust growth in international port operations. Its logistics business emerged as a key growth driver, with significant improvement in network scale and last-mile connectivity, further complementing port operations. The marine business also saw strong traction, reflecting operational scale-up and integration. Overall, with continued market share gains, capacity additions, and expansion in value-added segments like logistics, APSEZ is well positioned to grow faster than the broader industry,” Motilal Oswal said in its latest report. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates The shares of the company were trading at Rs 1,384.60 apiece in the early trading hours of August 6. The shares have dropped nearly 4 percent in the past one month, but gained nearly 18.5 percent in the past six months. The stock currently have a P/E ratio of around 27. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: CLSA has maintained an 'Outperform' rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,764 apiece.
summary_luhn: "Haifa port operated unhindered throughout and reported 25% YoY growth in container volume and 38% YoY growth in other cargo volume during the quarter, leading to overall volume growth of 29% YoY.
summary_lsa: This led to the highest quarterly revenue and operating EBITDA for Haifa port since acquisition by APSEZ," said Adani Ports in its press release.
summary_textrank: After the release of the results, the shares of the company dropped nearly 2 percent to close at Rs 1,362 apiece on August 5.

title: Buy Zydus Wellness; target of Rs 2304: Sharekhan
content: Sharekhan's research report on Zydus Wellness Zydus Wellness Limited’s (ZWL’s) Q1FY26 numbers were soft, with revenues growing by 2% y-o-y, while OPM fell 40 bps y-o-y to 18% and PAT declined by 13% y-o-y. Shorter summers and unseasonal rains hit performance. Excluding seasonal brands, growth was in double digits. We expect ZWL to clock a revenue/PAT CAGR of 12%/20%, respectively, over FY25-27 driven by a focus on margin resilience, tech-enabled efficiencies and sustainable growth through innovation and disciplined expansion. Outlook Stock trades at 31x/26x its FY26E/FY27E EPS, respectively. We maintain a Buy with an unchanged PT of Rs. 2,304. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 22 crore on August 5, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 3840 crore on the same day.
